  • Huang Lian (stir-fried): 0.1 qian

Grind into powder, mix with pig bile to form pills the size of millet. Take ten pills each time, using Mu Tong decoction. Huang Lian can eliminate harmful blood from the heart orifices.

Zhui Tan Pills
From "Wei Sheng Bao Jian"
For treating children's wind seizures and phlegm obstruction.
Ingredients:

  • Tian Nan Xing: 9 times steamed and dried. [198p]

　　右为末，姜汁面糊丸梧子大，每服二十丸，人参汤下，石菖蒲麦冬汤亦可。经验方曰：小儿惊风用坠涎散。天南星一两重一个，换酒浸七伏时取出，安新瓦上，周回炭火炙裂，合湿地出火。每为末，入朱砂一分，每服半钱，荆芥汤调下，每日空心一服，午时一服。
　　泻青丸 【《小儿直诀》，下同】 　治肝经实热。急惊搐搦。　　羌活按壬乙同归一治也　大黄泻诸实热　川芎入手足厥阴，辛以缓肝　山栀仁泻心火，实泻其子　龙胆草炒，益肝胆气止惊　当归入足厥阴藏血　防风各等分　　右为末，炼蜜丸芡实大，每服半丸，煎竹叶汤入砂糖化下。一方加甘草、芍药。一方无当归。薛己曰：前方足厥阴肝经，解散肌邪，疏通内脏之热，苦寒药也。若大便秘结，烦渴饮冷，饮食如常，属形病俱实，宜用此泻之。若大便调和，烦渴饮冷，目淡青色。属病气实而形气虚，宜用抑青丸平之。[199p]

The above is a formula for a remedy. The powder is made into balls the size of a wutong nut using ginger juice and flour. Take twenty balls each time, consuming them with ginseng soup; stone calamus and ophiopogon soup can also be used. According to experience, for children with convulsions, use Zuiyan powder. Take one or two liang of tian nansheng, soak in wine for seven days, then remove and heat gently on new tiles above a charcoal fire, allowing it to crack. Grind it into powder and add one fen of vermilion, taking half a qian each time mixed with jinjie soup on an empty stomach once daily and again at noon.

Xieqing Pill treats excess heat in the liver channel and urgent convulsions. Qianghuo and Yinbi both treat the same. Dahuang purges excess heat, Chuanxiong enters the hand and foot jueyin to alleviate liver tension. Gardenia fruit clears heart fire and purges its effects. Gentian is fried to nourish liver and gallbladder energy to stop convulsions. Angelica enters the foot jueyin to nourish the blood. Fangfeng is equally distributed.

Grind it into powder, and make honey pills the size of gorgon nuts. Each dose is half a pill, infused in bamboo leaf soup sweetened with sugar. One variation adds licorice and peony. Another does not include angelica. Xue Ji states: The previous formula for the foot jueyin liver channel disperses muscle pathogens and clears internal heat using bitter-cold medicine. If there is constipation, thirst for cold drinks, and normal appetite, it suggests a tangible illness; this should be treated with laxatives. If the bowel movements are regular, thirst for cold drinks, and the eyes are a light blue color, this indicates a tangible illness with weak vitality; in such a case, use Yiping pills to stabilize.[199p]

若大便不实，作渴饮汤，饮食少思，肢体倦怠，属形病俱虚，宜用地黄丸补之。若肝经血虚生风，先用四物汤加钓藤钩以生肝血，继用四君子汤以补脾土。若因肝经血燥生痰，用地黄丸生肾水，益肝血。若土不能培木，用四君子汤加当归以补中，用地黄丸以滋肾。若因肺金克肝木，用六君子汤加芍药、木香，实脾土以平肺金。若因心虚夺母之气，或肾水虚不能生肝木者，并用地黄丸主之。若屡服峻剂而脾胃虚寒者，必用六君子汤加丁香、木香，补脾胃以培阳气。若因乳母恚怒，肝火妄动，致儿为患者，每服加味小柴胡汤。若因乳母肝脾血虚发热，致儿为患者，母服加味逍遥散，子亦服数滴。《得效方》曰：一名凉肝丸。肝主风，宜先凉肝而风自退。
　　抑青丸
　　即前方去山栀、大黄。[200p]

If the stools are not solid, one should drink soup for thirst, eat less, and feel fatigue in the limbs, indicating a condition of deficiency. It is advisable to use Di Huang Wan to supplement. If there is wind generated by blood deficiency in the liver channel, first use Si Wu Tang with added Dao Teng Gou to nourish the liver blood, and then use Si Jun Zi Tang to tonify the spleen. If phlegm arises from dryness of the liver blood, use Di Huang Wan to nourish kidney water and benefit liver blood. If the earth cannot nourish the wood, use Si Jun Zi Tang with added Dang Gui to supplement the center, and Di Huang Wan to nourish the kidneys. If the lung metal restrains the liver wood, use Liu Jun Zi Tang with added Shao Yao and Mu Xiang to solidify the spleen earth and balance the lung metal. If the heart is deficient and deprives the mother’s qi, or if kidney water is deficient and cannot generate the liver wood, Di Huang Wan should be used to address it. If one frequently takes harsh medicines resulting in deficiency and coldness of the spleen and stomach, one must use Liu Jun Zi Tang with added Ding Xiang and Mu Xiang to tonify the spleen and stomach to support yang qi. If a nursing mother experiences anger and causes liver fire to act recklessly, affecting the child, add flavor to Xiao Chai Hu Tang for the child. If the nursing mother has liver and spleen blood deficiency with fever, affecting the child, she should take an enhanced Xiao Yao San, and the child should also take a few drops. The formula “De Xiao Fang” states: It is also called Liang Gan Wan. The liver governs wind, so one should first cool the liver to dispel wind.

Yong Qing Wan
This is the previous formula without Shan Zhi and Da Huang.[200p]

　　抑肝散　治肝经虚热发搐，或发热咬牙，或惊悸寒热，或木乘土而呕吐痰涎，腹膨少食，睡卧不安。　　软柴胡五分。入少阳厥阴泻肝火，须用黄连佐之　川芎八分　当归　白朮炒　茯苓保心惊悸　钓藤钩各一钱。主寒热十二惊癎客忤胎风　甘草三分　　右水煎，子母同服。

　　泻心散　治心经实热，泻丁心。
　　黄连一两，去须
　　右为末，每服五分，临卧温水化下。海藏曰：易老单方泻心汤出于此，乃实邪也。实则泻其子。薛己曰：按前证若叫哭发热，作渴饮水，抽搐有力，仰面而睡者，属心经实热，宜用泻心汤或导赤散。若发热饮汤，抽搐乏力，惊窜咬牙，合面而睡者，属心经虚热，用补心散。若咳嗽面赤，壮热饮水，肺乘心也，用泻白散。若头摇目札，身热抽搐，肝乘心也，用柴胡清肝散。若合目昏睡，泄泻身热，脾乘心也，用泻黄散。若窜视惊悸，咬牙足热，肾乘心也，用安神丸。若因乳母致证，亦用前药以治其母。[201p]

Yinggan San: This formula treats the liver meridian's deficiency-heat causing convulsions, or symptoms of fever with teeth grinding, or palpitations with alternating chills and fever, or vomiting phlegm due to wood overcoming earth, along with abdominal distension, reduced appetite, and restless sleep.

  • 0.5 drachm of soft Chaihu to clear the liver fire from the Shaoyang and Jueyin.
  • 0.8 drachm of Chuanxiong.
  • 1 drachm of Danggui.
  • 1 drachm of toasted Baizhu.
  • 1 drachm of Fuling to calm the heart and relieve palpitations.
  • 1 drachm of Diaoteng for hooks.

This formula addresses chills and fever, along with twelve types of convulsions caused by opposing fetal wind.

  • 0.3 drachm of Gancao.

Boil these together; both mother and child should take them together.

Xiexin San: This formula treats excess heat in the heart, cooling it.

  • 1 ounce of Huanglian, with the beard removed.

Grind this into powder, and every dose is 0.5 drachm, to be dissolved in warm water before bed. Haizang remarks: the simple formula "Xiexin Decoction" derived from this addresses true excess. For excess, we purge the child.

Xueji states: according to previous symptoms, if there is crying, fever, thirst to drink water, and strong convulsions while sleeping on the back, these fall under excess heat in the heart and should use Xiexin Decoction or Daohong San. If there is fever and drinking soup, weak convulsions, palpitations, and sleeping with face down, these indicate deficiency-heat in the heart, and should use Buxin San. If there is coughing with a red face, high fever, and drinking water, indicating lung controlling heart, use Xiebai San. If there is head shaking, eyes rolling, body heat, and convulsions indicating liver controlling heart, use Chaihu Qinggan San. If there is closed eyes and deep sleep, diarrhea, and body heat indicating spleen controlling heart, use Xiehuang San. If there are running eyes, palpitations, and teeth grinding indicating kidney controlling heart, use Anshen Wan. If caused by the wet nurse, the previous medicines should be used to treat the mother.[201p]

　　导赤散　治小肠实热，小便秘赤，泻丙小肠。　　生地心小肠药　木通利小肠热，故导赤也　甘草炙，各等分，生用泻心火　　右为末，每服一钱，入淡竹叶凉心经，水煎。一方加黄芩、赤芍药、羌活、灯心煎。一方不用甘草用黄芩。薛己曰：按泻心汤、导赤散，泻心小肠实火之剂。盖心为脾母，脾为心子。然心既病则脾土益虚矣，用者审之。味此说当保脾土。[202p]

Daohong San treats excess heat in the small intestine, with symptoms of dark, scanty urination. It purges the small intestine.

The ingredients include raw Rehmannia for the heart and small intestine, Mu Tong to clear heat from the small intestine, and roasted Licorice in equal portions, used raw to drain heart fire.

Prepare this as a powder; take one qian (about 3 grams) with cool bamboo leaves and water to decoct. One variation adds Huangqin, Chishao, Qianghuo, and Dengxin for decoction. Another variation omits Licorice and uses Huangqin instead.

Xue Ji stated that according to the Xiaxin Decoction and Daohong San, these are prescriptions for clearing heart and small intestine excess fire. The heart is the mother of the spleen, and the spleen is the child of the heart. However, if the heart is ill, the spleen is likely to be weak, so practitioners should be cautious. It is advisable to protect the spleen's earth.[202p]

　　生犀散　治心经虚热。
　　地骨皮　赤芍　柴胡　干葛各一两　甘草五钱　　右为末，每服一二钱，水煎。犀角二钱镑，主风热惊癎，镇肝除心热。丹溪曰：犀角痘后用以散余毒。若无毒而血虚者，或已燥热发散者而误用之，祸立至。薛己曰：按前方云治心经虚热，然其所用药，多属泻心泻肝之剂。盖虚热二字，恐传写之误。假如心经自病而血虚热者，用秘旨安神丸。脾虚夺心之气而热者，用秘旨补脾汤。肝木不能生心火而虚热者，用地黄丸。
　　秘旨安神丸　治心血虚而睡中惊悸，或受惊吓而作。　　人参补五脏止惊悸　半夏汤泡，燥脾土健胃　酸枣仁炒，宁心志　茯神各一钱，开心益志　五味子五粒，杵　当归酒洗　橘红　赤芍药炒，各七分　甘草炙，三分　　右为末，姜汁糊丸芡实大，每服一丸，生姜汤下。[203p]

Shengxi San treats the heart's empty heat.
Digu Pi, Chi Shao, Chai Hu, and Gan Ge, each one and two taels; Gan Cao, five qian. Grind these into a powder. Take one to two qian each time, decocted in water. Xi Jiao, two qian, is for wind-heat seizure, calming the liver and clearing heart heat. Danxi said: Xi Jiao is used post-pox to disperse residual toxins. However, if there is no toxin but the blood is empty, or if it has mistakenly been used when there is already dryness and heat, calamities will follow. Xue Ji said: The previous prescription states it treats the heart's empty heat, yet many of the medicines used mainly belong to the categories of draining the heart and liver. The term "empty heat" may likely be a transcription error. If the heart's disease originates from blood deficiency heat, use Mi Zhi An Shen Wan. If the spleen is deficient, seizing the heart's energy and causing heat, use Mi Zhi Bu Pi Tang. If the liver fails to nourish the heart fire, leading to empty heat, use Di Huang Wan.

Mi Zhi An Shen Wan treats heart blood deficiency leading to nighttime agitation and fright, or reactions from sudden scares.
Ren Shen replenishes the five organs and stops palpitations.
Ban Xia decocted strengthens the spleen and stomach.
Suan Zao Ren, stir-fried, calms the heart and mind.
Fu Shen, one qian, opens the heart and enriches the will.
Wu Wei Zi, five grains, ground.
Dang Gui, washed in wine.
Ju Hong, and Chi Shao, both stir-fried, each seven fen.
Gan Cao, roasted, three fen. Combine these into a powder, form into pills the size of Qian Shi with ginger juice as the binding agent. Each dose is one pill, taken down with ginger soup.[203p]

　　泻黄散　治脾胃实热。
　　藿香叶入手足太阴经，开胃止呕　甘草各七钱半　石膏五钱，泻胃火　山栀仁一两　防风二两　　右用蜜酒微炒为末，每服一二钱，水煎。薛己曰：按前证若作渴饮冷，卧不露睛，手足甚热，或遍身发黄，属胃经实热，宜用泻黄散。若作渴饮汤，卧而露睛，手足并冷，属胃经虚热，宜用异功散。若面青搐搦，乳食少思，肝乘脾也，用秘旨补脾汤。若面赤惊悸，身热昏睡，心乘脾也，用秘旨安神丸。若面白喘嗽，肢体倦怠，肺乘脾也，用补中益气汤。若唇黑泄泻，手足指冷，肾乘脾也，用益黄散。病后津液不足，口干作渴，宜用七味白朮散。若乳母膏粱厚味，七情郁火所致，当审其因而治其母。
　　瓜蒌汤　治慢惊。[204p]

Xie Huang San treats excess heat in the spleen and stomach.

Ingredients:

  • 7.5 qian of Huoxiang leaves (enters the hand and foot Taiyin channels) to enhance appetite and stop vomiting
  • 5 qian of gypsum to clear stomach fire
  • 1 liang of Sanjizhi (Cape Jasmine fruit)
  • 2 liang of Fangfeng

These are slightly stir-fried with honey wine and ground into a powder. The dosage is 1 to 2 qian, decocted in water. Xue Ji stated: If symptoms include thirst for cold drinks, lying down with eyes closed, hot hands and feet, or jaundice, this indicates excess heat in the stomach channel, and Xie Huang San should be used. If there is thirst for soup, lying down with exposed eyes, and cold hands and feet, this indicates deficiency heat in the stomach channel, and Yi Gong San should be used. If the face is green, with a writhing belly and little appetite for dairy, this indicates liver overacting on the spleen; use Mi Zhi Bu Pi Tang. If the face is red with anxiety, body heat, and somnolence, this indicates heart overacting on the spleen; use Mi Zhi An Shen Wan. If there is a pale face with wheezing and fatigue, indicating lung overacting on the spleen, use Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang. If there are black lips and diarrhea with cold fingers and toes, indicating kidney overacting on the spleen, use Yi Huang San. After illness, if fluids are insufficient, leading to dry mouth and thirst, use Qi Wei Bai Zhu San. If a nursing mother consumes rich and heavy foods, leading to emotional excess fire, the cause must be identified and treated in the mother.

Gua Lou Tang treats chronic fright.[204p]

　　瓜粪根二钱　白甘遂一钱
　　右，慢火炒黄为末，每二三分，煎薄荷麝香汤下。薛己曰：按徐用诚云：钱氏治慢惊用瓜蒌汤，恐传写误耳。盖惊主风木，甲木属阳，病急易治；乙木属阴，病缓难治。况小儿五脏之气未实，神气未完而自病之慢惊，非病后及吐泻脾胃虚损而得者，慎勿用此峻厉之剂。王肯堂曰：右瓜蒌汤，钱氏治慢惊法，脉有力者宜用。盖湿痰积于膈中，使风火不得开发而身冷，故用瓜蒌汤劫去湿痰，使风火得伸，而身温搐止。若脉无力者，不宜用之，便当补脾，及温白丸、羌活膏之类。
　　温惊丸　治慢惊风证。一名粉红丸。　　南星为末，入腊月牛胆中，阴干百日为末，四两　朱砂一钱半　天竺黄一两　坯子胭脂半钱　龙脑五分，另研　　右用牛胆汁和丸如鸡头大，每服一丸，小者半丸，砂糖水下。薛己曰：按慢惊属脾胃无阳，肝木所胜之寒证，故用温惊丸以温之。但所用之药，乃辛散阳气，袪逐痰涎，治者审之。[205p]

Ingredients:

  • 2 qian of melon dung root
  • 1 qian of white sweetwormwood

These should be lightly roasted over a slow fire until yellow and then ground into a powder. Each dose is 2-3 fen, taken with a decoction of mint and musk. Xue Ji explains: According to Xu Yongcheng, Qian’s treatment for gradual fright uses melon soup, fearing that there may be transcription errors. This is because fright is primarily due to the wind element, associated with the Yang of wood; acute conditions are easy to treat, while chronic conditions are difficult. Moreover, children’s internal organs are not fully developed, and when they experience gradual fright, it is not a result of post-illness or vomit and diarrhea leading to spleen and stomach deficiency. Thus, be cautious with such harsh remedies.

Wang Keng Tang adds: The melon soup on the right is a method by Qian for treating gradual fright, suitable for those with a strong pulse. This condition is caused by damp phlegm accumulating in the diaphragm, preventing wind and fire from resolving, leading to a cold body; hence the use of melon soup to eliminate damp phlegm allows wind and fire to manifest, warming and halting spasms. If the pulse is weak, it is inappropriate to use this; instead, one should supplement the spleen and apply warming formulas like Warming Fright Pill or similar remedies.

Warming Fright Pill: Treats symptoms of gradual fright. Also known as Pink Powder Pill.

Ingredients:

  • 4 liang of dried southern star (Nux vomica) powder, mixed with ox bile and air-dried for 100 days.
  • 1.5 qian of cinnabar
  • 1 liang of safflower
  • 0.5 qian of raw lip pigment
  • 5 fen of dragon brain (benzoin), ground separately.

The mixture should be made into pills the size of a chicken head; each dose is one pill, or half a pill for smaller children, taken with sugar water. Xue Ji states: Gradual fright is attributed to deficiency of the spleen and stomach Yang, with cold from the liver, hence Warming Fright Pill is used to warm it. However, the herbs included are primarily spicy and disperse Yang Qi to eliminate phlegm, and the practitioner should assess accordingly.[205p]

　　人参理中丸　治中气虚热。

　　调中丸　治脾胃虚寒。

Ren Shen Li Zhong Wan treats the deficiency heat of the middle Jiao.

Tiao Zhong Wan treats the cold and deficiency of the spleen and stomach.
Ingredients: Atractylodes, Ginseng, roasted Licorice, each 5 qian; powdered Dried Ginger, 4 qian.
Grind to a powder, use honey to form pills the size of a soybean, take 20 to 30 pills each time, with warm water. Xue Ji states: This prescription is derived from the classic texts for treating such conditions, namely Ren Shen Li Zhong Wan. If kidney water harms the spleen and leads to cold deficiency, add Ban Xia, Fu Ling, and Chen Pi; for vomiting, add Huo Xiang; for diarrhea, add Mu Xiang.

Zhang Shi Wen Pi San treats spleen and stomach depletion, abdominal and flank distension, poor appetite for dairy and food, and fatigue.
Ingredients: Heshizi meat, Ginseng each 7 qian; Atractylodes, Mu Xiang, Jie Geng, Fu Ling, Huo Xiang, Chen Pi, Huang Qi each 5 qian; roasted Licorice 2.5 qian.
For each dose, take 2 to 3 qian, decocted in ginger and jujube water. Xue Ji states: This formula treats the weakness of the spleen and lung; if lung conditions have resolved but symptoms still persist, use Liu Jun Zi Tang for the nourishment of the spleen and stomach.[206p]

Qingxin Pills: Treats shock, heat, and restlessness.

Anshen Pills: Treats evil heat causing fright and wailing, with excessive heat in the heart and liver, presenting with a yellow face and red cheeks.
Ingredients: Mai Men Dong (Ophiopogon), Ya Shao (Toothpaste), Bai Fu Ling (Poria), Shan Yao (Yam), Han Shui Shi (Cold Water Stone), Gan Cao (Licorice) each 5 qian, 1 liang of Vermilion, 2.5 fen of Dragon Brain. Grind into a powder, and roll into pills the size of the seeds of the lotus. Take half a pill, dissolved in sugar water. Xue Ji says: According to the earlier prescription, this reduces fire and transforms phlegm; it should not be taken in excess as it may harm the spleen and stomach. If there are fright and restlessness during sleep, the Secret Formula Anshen Pills should be used. If the mother’s temper is excessive and causes the child to suffer, the Modified Xiaoyao Powder should be used. If the mother’s anger causes liver heat affecting the child, the Modified Xiao Chai Hu Decoction should be used. If the mother drinks alcohol and the stomach heat affects the child, the Ge Hua Jie Cheng Decoction should be used.[207p]

　　朮附汤　治风湿相搏，身体烦疼，不能转侧，不呕不渴，大便坚硬，小便自利，及风证头目眩重等证。　　白朮四两　甘草炒，二两　附子炮去皮脐，一两半　　右为末，入附子，每服三钱，姜五片，枣一枚，水煎服。薛己曰：愚按附子温中回阳，为慢脾之圣药也。如元气未脱用之，无有不应。须用每只重一两三四钱，端正不尖，底平，周围如莲花辫者佳，否则悞川乌也。制法：切去皮尖，以童便浸之，秋冬七日，春夏五日，每日一换，浸毕，切作四块，以湿草纸包数层，微火煨半日，取出切幵，无白星为度。如急用，炮至裂纹，即投童便中良久，浸透切片，如色白，再微炙之。气脱甚者，急生用亦效。[208p]

Juzhi Decoction: Treats the condition of wind and dampness attacking the body, causing pain and discomfort, making it difficult to turn or shift position; with no vomiting or thirst, hard stools, and freely passing urine, as well as symptoms of wind causing dizziness and heaviness in the head.

Ingredients:

  • 4 taels of White Atractylodes (Bai Zhu)
  • 2 taels of roasted Licorice (Gan Cao)
  • 1.5 taels of processed Aconite (Fu Zi), peeled and with the seed removed

Method: Grind the above into a fine powder, then add Aconite. For each dose, take 3 qian, along with 5 slices of ginger and 1 jujube, and decoct in water for consumption.

Xue Ji states: "In my humble opinion, Aconite warms the center and restores yang; it is the premier medicine for the spleen's slow function. If the vital energy is not depleted, its efficacy is guaranteed. Use pieces weighing around 1.5 to 2.4 qian, regular and flat with a shape resembling a lotus flower; otherwise, they resemble poisonous black Aconite."

Preparation method: Cut off the pointed ends and soak in child's urine for a specified period—7 days in autumn and winter, and 5 days in spring and summer, changing the urine daily. After soaking, cut into four pieces, wrap them in several layers of damp paper, and gently simmer for half a day. After removal, cut open; if there are no white specks, it is prepared correctly. If needed urgently, process until cracks form, then immediately soak in child’s urine for an extended period, slice once fully soaked, and if the color is white, lightly roast again. For severe depletion of energy, urgent use is effective as well.[208p]

Jinbo Heart-Calming Pill treats wind, phlegm, and heat, restlessness of the heart, palpitations, thirst, dry lips, flushed cheeks, disturbed sleep at night, and delusions. Ingredients include one tael of朱砂, half tael each of white poria, ginseng, and licorice, one and a half taels of Chinese yam, one and a half qian each of sliced brain and tooth ash, five fen of musk, twelve sheets of gold leaf as a coating, and two and a half qian of purple river vehicle, boiled with black beans. Tiannanxing Powder treats vomiting, diarrhea, and chronic fright, dispelling wind and phlegm, or accidental ingestion of cold medicine, occurring when the spleen is weak leading to wind-phlegm. Also known as Resurrection Powder or Heavenly King Powder. Use one until nine qian of South Star, dig a pit about a foot deep, first burn five pounds of charcoal until it is red-hot, sprinkle a bowl of good rice vinegar into the pit, then add the South Star and densely cover it with the burning charcoal. Another bowl is used to cover it for a while to extract. Grind into a powder, adding one qian each of amber and whole scorpion, and take two words boiled with fresh ginger and wind-dispelling decoction. Additionally, add one qian of Tianma powder and one word of musk.[210p]

Ingredients: one qian each of musk, dragon brain, and antelope horn; one and a half qian each of danggui, fangfeng, huangqin, baizhu, muguo, and bai shao; two and a half qian each of niuhuang, chaihu, jiegeng, baifuling, skinless xingren, xionghuang, and rougui; eight fen of xionghuang; five fen of licorice; seven fen of white lian; two qian of rhinoceros horn; seven qian of shanyao; three qian of ganjiang; one hundred and twenty pieces of gold foil; and ten jujubes, steamed, softened, and ground. Grind together to a fine powder, form into pills with honey, making ten pills for every two qian. Coat with gold foil, taking one pill at a time, dissolved in warm water.[213p]

　　凉惊丸　治惊疳热搐，心神惊悸，白睛赤色，牙关紧急，潮热流涎，手足动搐。　　黄连五钱　龙脑一钱研　龙胆草酒拌炒黑　防风　青黛三钱，研　钓藤钩子二钱　牛黄　麝香各一字　　右各另为末，面糊丸粟米大，每服三五丸至一二十丸，煎金银花汤下。薛己曰：按前方治心肝二经风热，若心肝虚而见惊搐潮热，用秘旨安神丸。肝木乘脾者，用异功散加柴胡、钓藤钩。心脾虚弱而潮热流涎者，用异功散；若虚寒更加木香；不应，更加炮姜。疳者，津液干涸之证，前丸乃心肝二经，清热袪风化痰之寒剂，不宜多服，恐伤胃气，无以滋肾水也。[214p]

Liang Jing Wan: Treats panic, fever, nervous disorders, mental agitation, red eyes, tight jaws, tidal fever, excessive salivation, and twitching in hands and feet.

Ingredients:

  • Huang Lian (Coptis chinensis): 5 qian (a measure)
  • Long Nao (benzoin): 1 qian, ground
  • Long Dan Cao (Gentiana): mixed with wine and stir-fried until black
  • Fang Feng (sium): 3 qian, ground
  • Diao Teng (Diao vine extract): 2 qian
  • Niu Huang (Cattle bile) and She Xiang (Musk): each a character’s worth

Grind the above ingredients separately into a powder, mix with water to form pills the size of millet grains. Take 3 to 5 pills up to 10 to 20 pills per dose, and swallow with a decoction of Jin Yin Hua (Honeysuckle).

Xue Ji states: According to the previous prescription, it treats the wind-heat in the heart and liver meridians. If the heart and liver are deficient, leading to panic and tidal fever, use the An Shen Wan instead. If the liver's wood overacts on the spleen, add Chai Hu (Bupleurum) and Diao Teng. For those with weak heart and spleen and exhibiting tidal fever and salivation, use Yi Gong San (a formula); if there's deficiency and coldness, add Mu Xiang (saussurea); if it doesn’t respond, add Pao Jiang (dried ginger).

For panicked conditions, it is a symptom of dry fluids. The above pills, meant for the heart and liver meridians, are cold agents for clearing heat, dispelling wind, and transforming phlegm; they should not be taken in excess as they may damage stomach energy, leaving no nourishment for kidney fluid.[214p]

　　擦牙通关散　治风搐搦，关窍不通，痰塞中脘，留滞百节，牙关紧闭，药不能下。　　南星二钱　麝香一字　牙皂二锭，烧存性　赤脚蜈蚣一条　僵蚕一钱　　右为末，姜汁蘸药少许擦牙，或调服二三点，涎自出。
　　至圣保命丹　治胎惊内钓，肚腹紧硬，啼叫不安，及急慢惊风，眼目上视，手足抽掣，不省人事。　　全蝎十四个，去毒　防风二钱　白附子　蝉壳　炮南星　僵蚕去丝嘴炒　天麻　朱砂各一钱　麝香五分　金箔四十张　　右为末，米糊和，每两作四十丸，每服一丸，白汤化下。有热者，以胆星易炮星。一方有冰片、硼砂各少许。一方，有人参、白茯苓各二钱。[215p]

Toothpaste for Unblocking:

For treating wind-induced convulsions, when the orifices are blocked, phlegm obstructs the middle, and the body is stagnated, with the jaws tightly clenched making it impossible for medicine to be swallowed.

Ingredients:

  • Two qian of Nanshing
  • One piece of musk
  • Two pieces of tooth soap, burned to retain its essence
  • One barefoot centipede
  • One qian of silkworm
  • Grind these into a powder. Use a little ginger juice to moisten the medicine and apply it to the teeth, or mix with two or three drops to ingest. Saliva will flow naturally.

Ultimate Life Preservation Pill:

For treating internal distress from fright during pregnancy, with a tight and hard abdomen, causing crying and restlessness, also for sudden or chronic convulsions, with eyes looking upward, hands and feet twitching, and loss of consciousness.

Ingredients:

  • Fourteen whole scorpions, detoxified
  • Two qian of fangfeng
  • One qian each of white exorcist, cicada shell, fried Nanshing, and silkworm (silk removed and stir-fried)
  • One qian of tianma
  • Five fen of musk
  • Forty sheets of gold leaf

Grind these into a powder, mix with rice paste and form forty pills for each two qian. Take one pill, dissolved in white broth. For those with heat, substitute gallbladder star for fried star. One formula includes a small amount of borneol and borax. Another formula includes two qian each of ginseng and white poria.[215p]

　　大黄丸　治风热里实，口中气热，二便秘赤，饮水不止。　　黑牵牛半生半炒　川芎各半两　甘草一钱　大黄一两，酒洗饭上蒸　　右为末，糊丸麻子大，每服数丸，温蜜水乳后服，以溏利为度，大小量用。薛己曰：愚按前证既属里实二便秘，法当疏下。若初服虽未通利，而病势已退，不可再服。如二便未利，病势未退，当减数丸研化服之，恐过剂则元气伤而变病也。
　　十味安神丸　治惊。
　　人参　茯神　麦冬　山药各二钱　片脑二分　龙齿煅，一钱　朱砂　甘草　寒水石各五分　金箔二片　　右为末，蜜丸鸡豆大，灯心汤调下。一方有马牙硝。[216p]

Dahuang Pill: Treats wind-heat with interior excess, mouth heat, constipation with red urine, and incessant thirst.
Ingredients:

  • Half of black morning glory (raw and toasted)
  • Half a liang of Chuanxiong
  • One qian of licorice
  • One liang of rhubarb, washed with wine and steamed with rice.

Grind these into a powder, roll into pills the size of sesame seeds. Take several pills with warm honey water after meals, adjusting the dosage for appropriate effect. Xue Ji says: If the condition is already one of interior excess with constipation, the method should focus on purging. If after the initial dose there is no bowel movement but the illness has lessened, do not take more. If there is still no bowel movement and the illness is not alleviated, reduce the number of pills and consume them in a dissolved form, as excessive dosing may harm the vital energy and worsen the condition.

Ten-Flavor Tranquil Pill: Treats fright.
Ingredients:

  • Two qian each of ginseng, Fuling (Poria), Ophiopogon
  • Two fen of prepared acorus
  • One qian of calcined dragon teeth
  • Five fen each of cinnabar, licorice, and cold water stone
  • Two pieces of gold leaf

Grind these into a powder, mixing with honey to form pills the size of chickpeas, taken with lamp heart tea. A variation includes horse tooth ash.[216p]

　　蝎尾去毒　朱砂各五分　乌蛇肉酒浸焙　白矾　青黛　天麻各二钱　麝香一字　　右为末，每服三钱，水三碗，桃枝一握，煎至数沸温浴之，勿浴背。
　　涂顖法　治发搐。
　　麝香一字　蝎尾去毒　薄荷叶三分　蜈蚣　牛黄　青黛末各一字　　右同研，用熟枣肉剂为膏，新绵上涂匀贴顖上，四方可出一指许，火上炙手频熨，百日里外小儿可用此。

Bathing Method
To detoxify the scorpion's tail: 5 grams each of realgar and cinnabar, and snake meat soaked and roasted in wine; 2 grams each of alum, indigo, and Gastrodia elata, plus a single word of musk. Grind these into a powder. Each dose is 3 grams, with 3 bowls of water, and a handful of peach twigs. Boil until it reaches a rolling boil for a warm bath, avoiding bathing the back.

Topical Method
For treating spasms in the hair.
A single word of musk, detoxified scorpion's tail, 3 grams of mint leaves, centipede, and fine powder of ox gall and indigo, all in equal measure. Grind these together into a paste using cooked jujube flesh as a binding agent. Apply evenly onto the scalp and secure it with a cloth, allowing about a finger's width to be exposed. Heat over a fire and press down frequently. It can be used for children under a hundred days old.

Five-Color Pills
For the treatment of five kinds of convulsions.
5 grams each of cinnabar and pearl, 1 gram each of mercury and orpiment, and 300 grams of lead, mixed with mercury to form a powder. Form into pills the size of sesame seeds. Each dose is 3-4 pills taken with a decoction of mint and other fine herbs. One method does not include lead. Xue Ji states: My humble opinion is that there are various causes such as fright, wind, and food. Although phlegm may cloud the mind, one should primarily nourish the spleen qi.

Convulsion-Stop Pill
For illnesses that recur after recovery, with diverse symptoms that persist.
5 grams each of honey-roasted Astragalus, needle vine, and fine xixin, roasted licorice; 3 inches of snake skin roasted in wine; 4 pieces of cicada slough; and a single word of ox gall, ground separately. Grind this into a powder, boil jujube meat to form pills the size of sesame seeds. Each dose is 5-7 pills taken with a decoction of ginseng.[217p]

　　宣风散　治惊风痰热四证极效，能疏风导热。　　陈皮　甘草各五钱　牵牛四两，半生半炒　槟榔二个　　右为末，每服三五分，蜜汤调下。薛己曰：愚按肝气为阳为火，肝血为阴为水。肝气热则生风，风热搏则惊搐而肝血必损也。然有余当认为不足。若屡服利惊宣风之剂，未免亏损脾胃，以成慢惊矣，慎之！
　　褊银丸　治风涎膈热，及乳食不消，腹胀喘促。　　巴豆　水银各五钱　京墨八钱，火烧醋淬研　黑铅二钱半，水银煎　麝香五分，另研　　右为末，陈米粥丸菉豆大，每服二三丸，煎薄荷汤下。薛己曰：愚按前方治颠癎惊搐，消积下痰之药也。其用牵牛、巴豆等，盖以痰饮癖积，结聚坚固，非此不能除。故洁古张先生云为斩关夺旗之将，形病俱实者用之，诚有回生起死之功。必须详审，不可轻率。[218p]

Xuan Feng San: Effective for treating the four symptoms of wind, phlegm, heat, and fright. It can disperse wind and guide away heat.

Ingredients:

  • Dried tangerine peel and licorice, each 5 qian
  • Qian Niu (plant), 4 liang, half raw and half fried
  • Areca nut, 2 pieces

Grind these into a powder. Take 3 to 5 fen with honey water. Xue Ji comments: I believe that liver qi is yang and fire, while liver blood is yin and water. When liver qi is hot, it produces wind; when wind and heat collide, it causes convulsions and inevitably damages liver blood. However, if there is excess, it should be regarded as insufficient. If one frequently uses remedies to dispel wind and calm fright, it may compromise the spleen and stomach, leading to chronic fright. Caution is advised!

Bian Yin Wan: Treats phlegm from wind and heat at the diaphragm, as well as digestive issues from milk and food, with symptoms of abdominal distension and shortness of breath.

Ingredients:

  • Caster bean and mercury, each 5 qian
  • Beijing ink, 8 qian, roasted and soaked in vinegar
  • Black lead, 2.5 qian, boiled with mercury
  • Musk, 0.5 fen, ground separately

Grind these into a powder and form into pills the size of a mung bean using aged rice porridge. Take 2 to 3 pills with peppermint tea. Xue Ji comments: This formulation treats epilepsy, convulsions, and reduces phlegm accumulation. The use of Qian Niu and caster bean is intended to break the firm masses of phlegm and fluids. As the ancient Zhang states, it is like a general who seizes the strategic points in battle; it should be used only when symptoms are substantial, as it indeed has the power to restore life. Careful examination is essential; do not act rashly.[218p]

　　羌活膏　治脾虚肝热，热盛生风，或吐泻，或悞药为慢惊之证。亦治伤寒，无不效。　　羌活　人参　川芎　白附炮　赤茯苓各五钱　明天麻一两　白僵蚕酒炒　干蝎炒去毒　白花蛇肉酒浸焙　雄黄　辰砂各另研，一分　附子炮　防风　麻黄　肉豆蔻　鸡舌香　藿香　沉香　木香各二钱　轻粉　真珠　牛黄各一钱半　龙脑二分　麝香一钱，各另研　　右为末，炼蜜丸豆大，每服一二丸，薄荷汤下或麦冬汤下。按前方性温，大热实热，急惊勿服。　薛己曰：按前方药味杂乱，果脾气虚而成慢惊者。当审用之。恐发散真气，重损阴血故也。[219p]

Qianghuo ointment treats spleen deficiency and liver heat, with excessive heat generating wind, leading to either vomiting or diarrhea, or as a symptom of chronic fright from medicine. It also treats typhoid without exception.

The ingredients are: Qianghuo, Ren Shen (ginseng), Chuanxiong, Bai Fu Ling (white artemisia), and red Fu Ling (poria) each five qian; Ming Tian Ma (gastrodia) one liang; Bai Jiang Can (silkworm) roasted with wine, Gan Xie (scorpion) fried to remove toxins, and Bai Hua She (white flower snake meat) soaked and baked in wine; Xiong Huang (realgar) and Chen Sha (cinnabar) each ground separately, one fen; Fu Zi (prepared aconite) fried; Fang Feng (siler), Ma Huang (ephedra), Rou Dou Kou (nutmeg), Ji She Xiang (chicken tongue fragrant), Huo Xiang (agastache), Chen Xiang (aloeswood), and Mu Xiang (costus) each two qian; Qing Fen (light powder), Zhen Zhu (pearls), and Niu Huang (cattle bile) each one and a half qian; Long Nao (camphor) two fen; and She Xiang (musk) one qian, each ground separately.

These are to be made into a powder, refined with honey into pills the size of a broad bean. Each dose is one or two pills taken with mint decoction or Mai Dong (ophiopogon) decoction. Note that this formula is hot in nature, with strong heat, and should not be given during acute fright.

Xue Ji says: According to the ingredients in this formula, they are quite miscellaneous. If it is indeed due to spleen deficiency causing chronic fright, caution must be exercised in using it, as it may disperse true qi and severely damage yin and blood.[219p]

　　抱龙丸　治伤风温疫，身热昏睡，风热痰实壅嗽。又治惊风潮搐，及蛊毒中暑，沐浴后并可服。壮实小儿，宜时与服之。　　雄黄二钱五分　辰砂五钱另研　天竺黄一两　牛胆南星四两　麝香五分，另研　　右为末，甘草汤丸皂子大，每服一丸，白汤化下。丹溪曰：抱龙丸，心肺肝药也。抱者，保也；龙者，肝也。肝为母，心为子，母安则子安。况心藏神，肝藏魂。神魂既定。惊从何生？薛己曰：按前丸化痰袪邪清热之功居多，属肝心实热而致者，用之殊效。若脾肺虚弱而见昏睡痰嗽，当用宝鉴天麻散，以调补元气。[220p]

Baolong Pills treat wind-heat epidemics, body heat, and drowsiness, as well as cough caused by phlegm and wind-heat obstruction. They are also effective for convulsions caused by fright and toxic heat from "witchcraft," and can be taken after bathing. Healthy children should be given them occasionally.

Ingredients:

  • Realgar: 2.5 qian
  • Cinnabar: 5 qian, ground separately
  • Dragon's bile: 1 liang
  • South Star (a herb): 4 liang
  • Musk: 5 fen, ground separately

Grind these into a powder, mix with licorice soup to form pill-sized balls. Take one ball with warm water.

Danxi stated: The Baolong Pills are for the heart, lungs, and liver. "Bao" means to protect; "Long" refers to the liver. The liver is the mother, and the heart is the child; if the mother is at peace, the child is at peace. Moreover, the heart houses the spirit, and the liver houses the soul. Once the spirit and soul are settled, where can fright arise?

Xue Ji noted: The main functions of this pill are to resolve phlegm, expel evil, and clear heat, especially effective for conditions arising from excess heat in the liver and heart. However, if the spleen and lungs are weak, leading to drowsiness and phlegmy cough, then the Baojian Tianma Powder should be used to replenish the vital energy.[220p]

万氏曰：壮实儿宜用之。然内有雄朱金石之药，不可服。如麝香之耗真气，能引风邪入里，如油之入面不得出也。故人皆禁之，不轻用也。王肯堂曰：前药，百日小儿，每丸分作三四服；五岁儿一二丸；大人三五丸。亦治室女白带，伏暑用盐少许嚼一二丸，新汲水送下。腊月雪水煮，甘草和药尤佳。一法用浆水或新水，浸南星三日候透，煮软三五沸取出，乘软切去皮，只取白软者，薄切焙干炒黄色，取末八两，以甘草二两半拍破，用水二碗，浸一宿，慢火煮至半碗，去滓，渐渐倾入南星末内慢研，令甘草水尽，方入余药。[221p]

The Wan family said: Strong and healthy children should use it. However, within it contains medicinal substances like male red gold stone that cannot be consumed. For instance, musk consumes true vitality and can draw in the wind evil, much like oil cannot be expelled once it enters the skin. Therefore, everyone forbids it and does not use it lightly. Wang Kengtang said: For the medicine mentioned, for infants of a hundred days, each pill is divided into three or four doses; for five-year-olds, one or two pills; for adults, three to five pills. It also treats white discharge in young girls; for summer heat, chew a small amount of salt with one or two pills and swallow with freshly drawn water. Boiling snow water in the twelfth month, combined with licorice and the medicine, is especially good. One method involves soaking southern star root in rice water or fresh water for three days until it is translucent, then boiling it softly for three to five times, taking it out, cutting off the skin while soft, only taking the white soft part, thinly slicing it, drying it out, and roasting it until yellow. Take eight taels of this powder, with two and a half taels of licorice smashed, use two bowls of water to soak overnight, then slowly boil until half a bowl remains, remove the dregs, and gradually pour the southern star powder into it while slowly grinding, ensuring the licorice water is fully absorbed before adding the remaining medicine.[221p]

　　天麻散　治急惊脾胃虚弱，或变慢惊者。　　半夏七钱　天麻二钱五分　炙草　白茯苓　白朮各二钱　　右入生姜三钱，磁器内水煮，候干为末，每服一钱五分，姜枣汤调下。

Heavenly Energy Powder treats urgent fright with weakness of the spleen and stomach, or transforming into chronic fright.

Ingredients:

  • Pinellia (7 qian)
  • Gastrodia (2.5 qian)
  • Honey-fried Licorice, White Poria, and Atractylodes (2 qian each)

Process: Combine with 3 qian of fresh ginger, boil in a ceramic vessel with water until dry, then grind into a powder. Dosage: take 1.5 qian each time, mixed with ginger and jujube decoction.

Diao Teng Gou Decoction treats vomiting and diarrhea due to spleen and stomach deficiency, and chronic fright.

Ingredients:

  • Diao Teng Gou (3 fen)
  • Cicada shell, fried Fang Feng, Ginseng, Ephedra, fried Silkworm, Gastrodia, fried Scorpion tail (5 qian each)
  • Honey-fried Licorice and Chuanxiong (2.5 qian each)
  • Musk (1 qian, separately ground)

Process: Grind into a powder. Dosage: take 1 or 2 qian, boiled in water. If using a recipe that includes three scarabs (with heads and feet removed and fried until yellow), add 1 qian of Aconite for cold deficiency. Xue Ji notes that chronic fright symptoms are due to spleen and stomach deficiency. The previous formula is warming and dispersing, lacking in tonifying effects, so it should be used with caution![222p]

　　大青膏　治伤风吐泻，痰热发搐。
　　天麻　青黛各一钱　白附子　干蝎去毒　乌梢蛇肉酒浸焙　朱砂五分　天竺黄二钱　麝香二分　　右为末，生蜜和膏，每服一豆粒许，月中儿用半粒，薄荷汤化服。五岁以上，同甘露散服之。薛己曰：愚按大青膏，乃表散之剂也，必外邪蕴结于肺，而肺气未损者，乃可施之。况前证属脾肺气虚，而邪之所凑，必以固脾胃为主，否则虚虚之祸，恐不能免矣。
　　温白丸　治驱风豁痰定惊，泄泻瘦弱，冷疳洞利，及久病而成慢惊。　　天麻五钱　白僵蚕炮　白附子　干蝎去毒　天南星汤炮，焙，各二钱五分　　右为末，面糊丸菉豆大，每服十丸，米饮下。一方有人参、防风。一方前药仍用寒食日面裹养，七日取出，用姜汤下。薛己曰：愚按前证属脾气虚寒无阳之证，无风可散，无痰可逐，当兼用六君子汤十二味异功散、木香散。[223p]

Da Qing Gao: Treats wind-cold with symptoms of vomiting and diarrhea, phlegm heat leading to convulsions.
Tian Ma, Qing Dai each one qian; Bai Fu Zi, Gan Xie (toxic removed), Wu Shao She meat, soaked in wine and roasted, Zhu Sha five fen, Tian Zhu Huang two qian, She Xiang two fen. Combine these into a powder and mix with honey to form a paste. Each dose is about the size of a bean; for children, half a dose at the full moon, to be taken in mint tea. For those over five years old, use it with Gan Lu San. Xue Ji noted: "It seems that Da Qing Gao is a remedy for superficial dispersal; it should only be applied when external evils have settled in the lungs, and lung energy has not been damaged. Furthermore, the previous symptoms indicate a deficiency in spleen and lung qi, with the evil taking advantage of this. Strengthening the spleen and stomach must be the priority; otherwise, the dangers of deficiency cannot be avoided."

Wen Bai Wan: Treats expelling wind, resolving phlegm, calming fright, diarrhea, weakness, cold digestion, and prolonged illness leading to chronic fright.
Tian Ma five qian; Bai Jiang Can toasted; Bai Fu Zi, Gan Xie (toxic removed), Tian Nan Xing (toasted and roasted), each two qian and five fen. Combine these into a powder, make into pills the size of soybeans, take ten pills with rice drink. One formula includes Ren Shen and Fang Feng. Another formula uses the previous medicines, wrapped in dough on a cold food day, taken out after seven days, to be consumed with ginger tea. Xue Ji noted: "The previous symptoms are attributed to a deficiency of spleen qi, cold with lack of yang. If there's no wind to disperse, nor phlegm to expel, it is necessary to also use Liu Jun Zi Tang and Twelve Flavor Yi Gong San, along with Mu Xiang San."[223p]

　　牛黄丸　治惊热，消疳积。
　　雄黄研水飞　牵牛各一钱　天竺黄二钱　　右为末，面糊丸粟米大，每服五七丸，薄荷水下。
　　白饼子　治腹中有癖，伤食呕吐，肚痛嗳气，先用此药，一服推下食积；却用惺惺散、加减参苏饮，不可服冷药。　　滑石　轻粉　半夏汤浸焙　南星各一钱　巴豆二十四粒，去皮膜，水煮另研　　右为末，糯米饭丸菉豆大，捻作饼，每服二三饼，煎葱白汤下，忌热物。量儿加减。薛己曰；按前方乃斩关夺门起死回生之重剂也，必审形病俱实，方可施之。恐致失手，命在反掌。经云：邪之所凑，其气必虚；留而不去，其病乃实。实者，病气实而形气则虚也。东垣先生云：形病俱实者，皆泻不当补；形病俱虚者，当补不当泻。治者审之！
　　蛇黄丸　治惊癎。因震骇恐怖，叫号恍惚是也。　　蛇黄真者三个，火煅醋淬　郁金七分，一处为末　麝香另入一匙　　右为末，饭丸桐子大，每服一二丸，煎金银磨刀水化下。[224p]

Niu Huang Wan treats excessive heat and dissipates accumulations.

Xiong Huang is ground with water, with Qian Niu and Tian Zhu Huang both one qian each. Combine these into a powder, mix with a dough to form pills the size of millet. Take five to seven pills each time, swallowed down with mint water.

Bai Bing Zi treats internal masses, food injury leading to vomiting, abdominal pain, and belching. First use this medicine to push down food accumulation; then use Xing Xing San and modified Shen Su Decoction. Cold medicines must not be taken.

Hua Shi, Qing Fen, Ban Xia, and Nan Xing are all one qian each; for Ba Dou, use twenty-four seeds, removing the skin and membrane, boil in water and grind separately. Combine into a powder, form pills the size of mung beans, and take two to three pills each time, swallowed with green onion broth, avoiding hot substances. Adjust dosage for children.

Xue Ji states: This formula is a powerful remedy that can save a life. One must thoroughly assess the condition before administering it, as there is a risk involved. The classic states: where evil gathers, its energy must be weak; if it lingers, the illness becomes real. The real illness is the pathogenic energy being strong while the body's energy is weak.

Mr. Dong Yuan states that when the body's condition is fully real, a purging treatment is necessary, not a tonifying one; when the body's condition is completely weak, tonifying is appropriate, not purging. The practitioner must carefully assess!

She Huang Wan treats seizures caused by fright and terror, manifesting in shouting and confusion.

True She Huang consists of three parts, calcined in vinegar. Mix with seven parts of Yu Jin, grind together into a powder, adding a spoonful of musk separately. Form into pills the size of jujubes, taking one to two pills each time, dissolved in golden-silver ground water.[224p]

　　牛黄丸　治风癎，因汗出解脱，风邪乘虚，迷闷搐掣，涎潮屈指如计数是也。　　牛胆南星　全蝎焙　蝉蜕各二钱半　防风　白附子生用　天麻　直僵蚕炒，各一钱半　麝香半字　　右为末，枣肉和丸，水银半钱，研细入药，丸菉豆大，每服一二丸，荆芥生姜汤下。

Niu Huang Wan: Treats convulsions due to wind. It is effective after sweating and relieves the invasion of wind evils, causing confusion, convulsions, and drooling. The symptoms include curling fingers as if counting. Ingredients include 2.5 qian of Niu Dan Nan Xing, baked Quan Scorpion, and Cicada Slough; 1.5 qian each of Fang Feng, Bai Fu Zi (raw), Tian Ma, and fried Jiao Chan; half a character of Musk. These should be powdered, combined with jujube flesh to form pills, with 0.5 qian of mercury finely ground into the medicine. Take 1-2 pills with a decoction of Jing Jie and fresh ginger.

Miao Sheng Dan: Treats food convulsions that occur due to shock and results in stop of food intake along with vomiting milk, experiencing cold and hot sensations, and having foul-smelling stools. Ingredients include calcined Zhe Shi (2.5 qian), 3 He Shou Wu (stamina beans) with seeds removed, 3 qian of oil; 1 qian each of xiong huang (realgar), scorpion tail, and Zhu Sha (cinnabar); and 1 spoon each of light powder and musk; 2 qian of slightly roasted apricot kernels. These should be powdered, combined with jujube flesh to form pills the size of walnuts. Take 1-2 pills, followed by a decoction of Horsetail.

Xiao Feng Wan: This medicine is recommended first for treating convulsions due to wind.

Ingredients include 2 qian of Niu Dan Nan Xing; 1 qian each of Qiang Huo, Du Huo, Fang Feng, Tian Ma, Ren Shen, Jing Jie, Chuan Xiong, and Xi Xin. These should be powdered, formed into honey pills the size of tung seeds. Take 2 pills, mixed with a decoction of mint and Perilla.

Qu Feng Bao An Wan: This is effective for long-standing wind conditions.[225p]

　　蝎虎散　治惊癎。[226p]

Chuanwu, peeled and尖, 2.5 qian, used raw; Wulingzhi, half a liang. Grind the above into a powder, form into pills the size of a tung seed, take 1-2 pills with ginger decoction.

This is a formula for treating epilepsy; use this medicine first.

Ren Shen, amber, white poria, yuan zhi prepared with ginger, stir-fried meat, cinnabar, tian ma, finely ground shi chang pu, chuan xiong, nan xing, qing dai, each 1 qian; musk, 1 spoon. Grind the above into a powder, form into pills the size of a tung seed, take 1-2 pills with jinyin mint decoction. One formulation has huai shan and gan cao, but no amber or qing dai.

Hu jing wan treats the evil qi of epilepsy entering the heart.

Hu jing, finely ground; yuan zhi soaked in ginger juice, heart removed; rhino horn shavings; da huang wrapped in wet paper and steamed; shi chang pu; mai men dong, all of equal parts; three scarab beetles, feet and wings removed and stir-fried. Grind the above into a powder, form into pills the size of a tung seed, take 1-2 pills with bamboo leaf decoction or jinyin mint decoction.

Qing shen decoction treats epilepsy.

Rhino horn shavings; yuan zhi roasted with ginger juice; white lichen skin; shi chang pu; ren shen; gan cao, stir-fried, each 1.5 qian. Grind the above into a powder, take 5-7 fen with mai men dong decoction.

Mi tuo seng powder treats heart epilepsy without speech and other cases of shock and loss of voice. Mi tuo seng, grind finely, take 1 spoon with rice vinegar decoction; adults take 1 qian with hot wine.

Scorpion and tiger powder treats epilepsy.[226p]

　　褐色生蝎虎一个，连血细研
　　右入朱砂、麝香末少许同研，用薄荷汤调作一服。数年者亦效。盖癎疾皆心血虚滞，生蝎虎管守其血。继服二陈汤。若无生蝎，以带性雄猪心血代用。入代赭石散尤妙。

　　化风丹　凉风化痰，退热定搐。
　　牛胆南星二钱　羌活　独活　防风　天麻　人参　川芎　荆芥　粉草各一钱　全蝎一个　　右为末，炼蜜丸皂角子大，每服一钱，薄荷汤化下。一方无全蝎，有甘草、细辛。一方加辰砂、麝香。
　　茯神汤　治胆气虚寒，头痛目眩，心神恐惧，不能独处，或是惊癎。　　茯神　枣仁炒　黄芪炒　柏子仁炒　白芍炒　五味子炒，各一两　桂心　熟地黄自制者　人参　甘草炒，五分　　右每服二三钱，姜水煎。[227p]

A brown scorpion is ground finely, mixed with a small amount of realgar and musk, and prepared with peppermint tea to make a dose. This is effective for several years. The reason is that epilepsy is caused by the stagnation of heart blood, and the scorpion helps control the blood. After this, continue with Er Chen Tang. If scorpions are unavailable, use the blood of a male wild boar instead. Adding daizhi stone powder is particularly wonderful.

Daizhi Stone Powder treats both yin and yang epilepsy. The daizhi stone is calcined, rinsed with vinegar, ground into powder, and then water-floated and dried. This becomes the powder, and each dose is taken with half a qian, decocted with gold and silver, mixed with gold foil and silver foil, taken in two doses. If there are red spots on the shins, that indicates the evil qi is releasing, and it can be treated; if there are no red spots, it is difficult to treat.

Huafeng Dan cools wind, dispels phlegm, reduces heat, and calms convulsions. It consists of two qian of cattle gall, Nánxīng, Qianghuo, Duhuo, Fangfeng, Tianma, Ginseng, Chuanxiong, Jingjie, and one qian each of powdered grass, with a whole scorpion. Grind the ingredients into powder, make honey pills the size of a soapberry, and take one qian with peppermint tea. If whole scorpion is unavailable, substitute with licorice and Xixin. If adding, include cinnabar and musk.

Fushen Tang treats deficiency and cold of the gallbladder qi, headaches, dizziness, anxiety, and fear, and those who cannot be alone or may have fright-induced epilepsy. The ingredients are each one or two liang of Fushen, fried jujube seed, fried Astragalus, fried Baiziren, fried white peony, and fried Schisandra; and five fen each of cassia heart, self-prepared cooked Rehmannia, ginseng, and fried licorice. Each dose is two to three qian and boiled with ginger water.[227p]

Sour Jujube Seed Pill treats stern heat and fright caused by excessive gallbladder energy, or uneasy sleep, anxiety, and palpitations. Ingredients include: fried Sour Jujube Seed, Poria, Polygala, fried Biota Seed, Fangfeng, fried Bitter Orange Peel, and powdered Fresh Rehmannia, each half a tael; 2.5 qian of fragrant bamboo reed. Grind these separately into powder, form into honey pills the size of millet, and take 70 to 80 pills each time with boiling water.

Calming the Spirit Pill treats a weak and timid heart spirit, with similar symptoms; or pertains to speaking of ghosts and deities, with excessive laughter and fright. Ingredients are: 1.5 taels each of Ginseng and Poria; 1 tael each of Acorus and Polygala. Grind these separately into powder and form into honey pills as previously mentioned.

Nourishing the Heart Decoction treats deficiency of heart blood and dispels fright and epilepsy. It may present as anxiety, palpitations, night sweats with insomnia, fever, and irritability. Ingredients include: 3 qian each of Astragalus, white Poria, Poria, fermented Pinellia, Angelica, Chuanxiong, spicy cinnamon, Biota Seed, Jujube Seed, Schisandra, and Ginseng; 4 qian of fried Licorice. The prescribed dosage is 1 to 2 qian per time, boiled in ginger and jujube water.

Wonderful Aroma Powder treats insufficient heart energy, fright and epilepsy, or mental confusion, irritability with little sleep, and symptoms of night sweats. Ingredients are: 3 qian of cinnabar, 1 qian of musk, 2.5 qian of roasted Wood Aroma, 1 tael each of Poria, yam, Poria, Polygala, and fried Astragalus; 5 qian each of Platycodon and fried Licorice, and Ginseng. Grind these separately into powder, and take 1 qian each time, mixed with warm wine or clear soup.[228p]

小儿惊癎门

　　利痰丸 【《幼科全书》，下同】[229p]

Great Black Dragon Pill
Effective for treating sudden and chronic convulsions in children.
One tael each of ox gall and south star, and limestone, burned with equal parts of nitre. Half a tael each of bezoar stone and indigo, two taels and five qian of aloe, three qian of cinnabar, five fen of silkworm, two and a half qian of centipede, fire-burned for preservation.
Grind the above into fine powder, simmer with licorice syrup, and form into pills the size of chickpeas. Take one or two pills, administered with peppermint decoction for sudden convulsions, and with platycodon and white atractylodes decoction for chronic convulsions.

Divine Cow Yellow Life-Saving Powder
Half a tael of areca nut, three qian of wood fragrance, and two taels of rhubarb, wrapped in flour and baked into powder. One tael each of white and black nightshade, coarsely ground, half used raw and half fried.
Grind these into fine powder, add a little light powder. Take two qian each time, mixed with honey syrup water, at any time, with a slight profit as the measure.

Emerald Cloud Powder
Effective for treating children's convulsions with salivation.
Half a tael of blue vitriol, one qian of powdered frost, and one fen each of copper green and light powder.
Grind these into fine powder, take one character, mixed with peppermint decoction. For stroke, use it mixed with gruel.

Niudan Nixing: one qian each of Cow Gall, Zhi Ke with kernel removed, and Chen Pi with white parts removed; five qian of Da Huang; two qian of Qian Niu Tou powder; mix into a fine powder, boil with soap pod water, and take with lampwick decoction.

An Shen Wan: two qian each of Huang Lian with roots and hairs removed, Shi Chang Pu, Yuan Zhi with heart removed, Dang Gui body, Mai Men Dong with heart removed, and Shan Zhi Ren fried; eight qian of Fu Shen; mix into powder, combine with millet paste, use pork heart blood to form into pills, coated with cinnabar, and take with lampwick decoction.

Shen Gui Dan: three qian each of Xiong Huang, Sang Ji Sheng, Tian Zhu Huang, and Diaoteng Gou; two qian each of Quan Xie with legs removed, Cow Gall, Nixing, Wu Tong Lei, and Jiang Can fried; one qian each of Zhen Zhu, Niu Huang, and Amber; a little Bing Pian; use the above for powder, mix with millet flour paste for cakes, coated with gold leaf, taken with mint, lampwick, and bamboo leaf decoction.

Dao Chi San: Niu Huang, Mu Tong, Gan Cao tips, Mai Men Dong with heart removed, Shan Zhi Ren, and seven bamboo leaves; boil in water and take. A medicine to drain heart fire. To disperse, add Fang Feng and Mint.

Wu Se Wan: two qian each of Huang Qin and Huang Lian; three qian of Da Huang; without color, called San Huang Wan; with color, named Wu Se Wan. Mix into a fine powder, divide into five parts, moisten with water to form pills. One part with Qingtai for coating, called Qing Wan; one part with Cinnabar for coating, called Hong Wan; one part with Xiong Huang for coating, called Huang Wan; one part with burned Zao Jiao ash for coating, called Hei Wan.[230p]

　　半夏炮　川乌　白附子各五两　南星三两　　右为细末，以生绢袋盛，用井水摆尽为度，放磁器内，日晒夜露，一日一换水，必搅数转，候如玉片再研细。又用青蒙石一钱另研细，以焰硝五分，同石末入铜锅内，火煅通红，硝尽为度，放冷，入上药和匀，以糯米为丸，以薄荷入蜜送下，其痰自坠。

Ding Chuan Decoction
Aged tangerine peel, processed south star, gardenia seeds, soft gypsum, almond paste, mint leaves, red poria. Boil these in water and add bamboo juice.

Qingzhou White Pills
For treating child convulsions.
Processed pinellia, chuanwu, and white fuzi, each five taels; south star three taels. Grind these into a fine powder, place in a silk bag, and soak in well water until saturated. Place in a ceramic container, sun-dry during the day and dew under the night, change water daily, making sure to stir several times, continuing until it looks like jade flakes and then grind it finer. Grind an additional qi ming stone, one qian, and mix it finely with five fen of nitre; then, place both powders in a copper pot and heat until red-hot until the nitre is fully consumed, allow to cool, and mix with the above medicines. Form into pills using glutinous rice and take with mint in honey, which will help expel phlegm.

Tiao Yuan Decoction
The Inner Canon states: "Excess heat within should be countered with sweet to drain and with sour to restrain." This is what it refers to.
One qian of Huangqi, five fen each of ginseng and white peony, two and a half fen of roasted licorice. Boil these in water and consume.

Huangqi Decoction
For treating chronic convulsions and greenish diarrhea. This condition arises from liver wood attacking spleen earth; first solidify the earth, then drain the wood. This is the method of divine treatment.
Two qians of Huangqi, one qian of ginseng, five fen of roasted licorice.[231p]

　　右(口父)咀，作一服，水一大盏，煎至半盏，去滓，食远服。加白芍药尤妙。此三味皆甘温，能补元气。甘能泻火。内经云：热淫于内，以甘泻之，以酸收之。白芍药酸寒，寒能泻火，酸味能泻肝而大补肺金，所补得金土之位大旺；火虚，风木何由而来克土？然后泻风之邪。夫益黄散、理中丸、养神丸之类，皆治脾胃寒湿大盛神品之药也。若得脾胃中伏热劳役不足之证，及服热药巴豆等之类，胃虚而成慢惊之证，用之必伤人命。夫慢惊风者，皆由久泻脾胃虚而生也。钱氏以羌活膏疗慢惊风悞矣。脾虚者，由火邪乘其土位，故曰从后来者为虚邪。火旺能实其木，木旺故来克土，当于心经中以甘温补土之源，更于脾土中泻火以甘寒，于脾土中补金以酸凉，致脾土中金旺火衰，风木自虚矣。损食多进药自愈，前药是也。[232p]

Prepare a decoction with one mouthful of the medicine and one large cup of water, simmer until reduced to half a cup, strain, and consume regularly. Adding white peony root is especially beneficial. These three ingredients are all sweet and warm, capable of replenishing vital energy. Sweetness can clear heat. The Inner Canon states: when heat is excessive within, it should be mitigated with sweetness and contained with sourness. White peony root is sour and cool, which can also clear heat; its sour flavor can drain the liver while greatly nourishing the lungs, thereby enhancing both metal and earth energies. When fire is deficient, how can wind and wood overcome the earth? Thus, expel the邪 of wind. Formulas like Yao Huang San, Li Zhong Wan, and Yang Shen Wan are all excellent remedies for conditions of excessive cold dampness in the spleen and stomach. If heat dynamic is trapped within the spleen and stomach due to insufficient effort and one takes hot medicines like ba dou, it can lead to a weak stomach and chronic shock syndrome, which can be harmful. Chronic shock is always due to a prolonged weakening of the spleen and stomach. Qian's method using Qiang Huo ointment to treat chronic shock has proven effective. For those with spleen deficiency, fire pathogens take advantage of their earth's position, which is why this condition is called “virtual邪.” When fire is strong, it can bolster wood, and when wood is abundant, it can attack the earth. Therefore, in heart conditions, one should sweetly and warmly nourish the source of earth, while in the spleen, drain heat with cool sweetness and fortify metal with sour cold, leading to a strong metal and weak fire in the spleen, thus alleviating the wind and wood. Reducing food intake and increasing medicinal consumption will lead to self-recovery; the aforementioned medicines can aid in this.[232p]

　　益黄散　治胃中风热。
　　黄芪二钱　陈皮　人参各一钱　芍药七分　生甘草　熟甘草各五分　黄连少许　　右共为细末，每服二钱，水一盏，煎至五分，食前服。一方加白茯苓。
　　补阳汤　时初冬一小儿二岁大寒证，明堂青脉，额上青黑，脑后青络高起，舌上白滑，喉鸣而喘，大便微青，耳尖冷，目中常常泪下，仍多胸中不利，卧而多惊，无搐则寒。　　吴茱萸　生地黄　地龙各五分　黄蘗　橘皮　葛根　连翘　蝎梢　炙甘草各一分　升麻　黄芪　柴胡各二分　当归身　麻黄各三分　　右(口父)咀，都作一服，水一大盏半，煎至六分，去滓，乳食后热服。服药之后，添喜笑，精神出，气和顺，乳食旺。[233p]

Yi Huang San: Treats stomach wind-heat.
Ingredients: 2 qian of Astragalus, 1 qian each of dried tangerine peel and ginseng, 7 fen of peony root, 5 fen each of raw and cooked licorice, a pinch of Coptis. Grind these into a fine powder. For each dose, take 2 qian with 1 cup of water, decoct until reduced to 5 parts, and take before meals. One variation adds white poria.

Bu Yang Tang: For a small child, 2 years old, with a cold syndrome in early winter. Symptoms include a bluish vein on the forehead, a bluish-black forehead, a prominent bluish vein at the back of the head, a white slippery tongue, wheezing and coughing, slightly bluish stools, cold tips of the ears, constant tearing from the eyes, significant discomfort in the chest, frequent disturbance in sleep, but without spasm indicates cold.
Ingredients: 5 fen each of Wu Zhu Yu, raw Rehmannia, and earthworm; 1 fen each of goldthread, tangerine peel, kudzu root, forsythia, scorpion tail, and roasted licorice; 2 fen each of Angelica, Astragalus, and Bupleurum; 3 fen each of Angelica and Ephedra.
Grind these together into a single dose, add 1.5 large cups of water, decoct until reduced to 6 parts, strain, and take warm after the milk feed. After taking the medicine, bring joy and laughter, improving spirit and harmonizing the qi, resulting in robust appetite.[233p]

　　琥珀抱龙丸 【《育婴家秘》，下同】 　理小儿诸惊，四时感冒风寒，温痰邪热，致烦噪不宁，痰嗽气急，及疮疹欲出发搐，并宜服之。　　真琥珀　天竺黄　檀香细銼　人参去芦　白茯苓去皮，各一两半　生粉草三两，去节　枳壳麸炒　枳实俱水浸，去穰炒微黄，各一两　山药去黑皮，一斤，銼作小块，慢火炒令热透冷用　南星一两，銼碎，用腊月雄黄牛胆酿经一夏　朱砂五两，先以磁石引去铁屑，次用水乳钵内细杵，取浮者飞过，凈器内澄清，去上余水，如此法一般精制，见朱砂凈尽，晒干用　取见成药末一两，同金箔百片，在乳钵内研极细，仍将前末共一处和均，取新汲井水为丸，如豌豆样大粒，阴干，每服用薄荷汤化下。琥珀抱龙丸内，用补益之药，人皆喜而用之。然有枳壳、枳实二味，能散滞气。无滞气者，能损胸中至高之气。如慢惊及元气弱者，减去此二味，可用当归、川芎各二两以代之。然琥珀、天竺黄二味，须择真者。[234p]

Amber Dragon Ball

This remedy is for children experiencing fright, seasonal wind and cold, excessive phlegm and heat, leading to restlessness and agitation, as well as coughing and difficulty breathing, and when rashes are about to erupt. It is also suitable for their treatment.

Ingredients include:

  • Genuine amber: 1.5 taels
  • Turmeric: 1.5 taels
  • Finely powdered sandalwood: 1.5 taels
  • Ginseng (peeled): 1.5 taels
  • White poria (peeled): 1.5 taels
  • Fresh licorice: 3 taels (cut to remove joints)
  • Bitter orange peel (roasted): 1 tael
  • Bitter orange (soaked in water, roasted until slightly yellow): 1 tael
  • Chinese yam (peeled, cut into small pieces, stir-fried over low heat until thoroughly heated): 1 pound
  • Noxious star (shredded): 1 tael (fermented with sulfur and cow bile over the summer)
  • Cinnabar: 5 taels (first use a magnet to remove iron filings, then grind in a mortar to remove floating impurities; clarify in a clean container and drain excess water, following this process to refine it until pure, then dry for use)

Combine the final powdered medicine (1 tael) with 100 sheets of gold leaf, grind together very finely in a mortar, blend with the previous mixture, then form into pills the size of green peas using fresh well water, and air-dry. Each dose should be taken with mint decoction.

Amber Dragon Ball contains nourishing ingredients that everyone appreciates. However, the two ingredients, bitter orange peel and bitter orange, can disperse stagnant energy. For those without stagnant energy, they may weaken the vital energy in the chest. In cases of chronic fright or weakened vital energy, these two ingredients should be reduced; they can be replaced with 2 taels each of angelica and chuanxiong. Ensure that the amber and turmeric are genuine.[234p]

王肯堂曰：前十二味，除朱砂、金箔不入碾内，余十味檀香不过火外，九味或晒或焙，同研为末，和匀，朱砂、金箔每一两重。取新汲井水一两，重入乳钵内略杵匀，随手丸如鸡头子大，阴干。晴霁略晒。日色燥甚则折裂。宜顿放当风处，取其自干。治法并用葱汤，无时化服，或薄荷汤。痰壅嗽甚，淡姜汤下。痘疮见形有惊，温净汤下。心悸不安，灯草汤下。暑天闷迷，麦门冬熟水下。百日内婴儿，每丸作三次投。二岁已上者，止一丸或二丸。[235p]

Wang Kengtang said: The first twelve ingredients, excluding vermilion and gold leaf which are not ground together, and among the remaining ten, sandalwood is the only one not subjected to heat. Nine of the ingredients are either sun-dried or roasted, ground into a powder, and mixed evenly. Use one tael of vermilion and one tael of gold leaf. Take one tael of fresh well water, slightly pound it in a mortar, and roll it into balls the size of a chicken egg, then dry in the shade. In sunny weather, avoid excessive exposure to sunlight as it may cause cracking. It is advisable to leave them in a windy place to dry naturally. The preparation method also uses scallion broth, to be taken at any time, or mint broth. If phlegm causes severe coughing, take it with light ginger broth. If smallpox appears unexpectedly, take it with warm clean broth. For palpitations and unease, take it with lamp grass broth. In hot weather, if there is fatigue or confusion, take it with water from cooked Ophiopogon. For infants within a hundred days, take three doses of each pill. For those over two years old, limit to one or two pills.[235p]

其品剂修合之时，但缺一味，不依制度，必无效矣。常用瓦瓶入麝香同收，毋使散泄气味。入珍珠末一两合和，名金珠散。珍珠能镇心宁肝，坠痰尤效。治法汤使同前。又曰：抱龙之义，抱者保也，龙者肝也。肝应东方青龙木，木生火，所谓生我者父母也。肝为母，心为子，母安则子安。心藏神，肝藏魂，神魂既定，惊从何生？故曰：抱龙丸理小儿诸惊，四时感冒风寒，温疫邪热，致烦躁不宁，痰嗽气急，及疮疹欲出发搐，并宜可投。其药性温平，不憯不燥。常服袪风化痰，镇心解热，和脾胃，益精神。[236p]

When preparing the medicinal formula, if one ingredient is missing and it does not follow the established standards, it will surely be ineffective. Always use a ceramic bottle to combine with musk, to prevent the scent from dissipating. Mix in one tael of pearl powder, called "Golden Pearl Powder." Pearls can calm the heart and soothe the liver, particularly effective for expelling phlegm. The method of preparation is the same as before. Moreover, the meaning of "embracing the dragon" is to protect, with the dragon representing the liver. The liver corresponds to the eastern azure dragon of wood; wood generates fire, which symbolizes the nurturing parents. The liver is the mother, and the heart is the child; if the mother is stable, so shall the child be peaceful. The heart stores the spirit, and the liver stores the soul; if the spirit and soul are settled, where can anxiety arise? Thus, it is said that "Embracing Dragon Pill" treats various disturbances in children, such as seasonal colds from wind and cold, warm epidemic heat causing restlessness, phlegm cough with breathlessness, and prevention of emerging sores and rashes, all suitable for administration. Its medicinal nature is warm and balanced, not harsh or drying. Regular use disperses wind, transforms phlegm, calms the heart, relieves heat, harmonizes the spleen and stomach, and nourishes the spirit.[236p]

　　抱龙丸　抱者养也。龙者纯阳之物，盖震为龙，东方乙木也，为少阳之气。时至乎春，乃万物发生之始气也。乙者肝木也，肝为风木，初生小儿，纯阳无阴，龙之象也。肝为有余，少阳之气壮也。肝主风，小儿病则有热，热则生风。上医虑之，制此方以平肝木，防惊风，此抱龙之名义也。小儿必用此药，所以养其阴而济之，令不太过也。又青龙位肝木属之，小儿肝常有余，脾常不足，故以此药抑肝扶脾，乃名抱龙。治形实壮热，昏睡气粗，或痰壅嗽惊风搐搦。　　天竺黄　辰砂各一钱　牛黄二分　麝香半分　珍珠　琥珀　白檀香　枳壳　枳实各三分　牛胆星五钱，腊月取牛胆一个，将南星去皮脐研为末放于胆中，阴干备用　共为末，山药打糊为丸如黄豆大，金箔为衣。潮热，灯心汤化下；惊风，薄荷汤下；咳嗽，滚白水下。[237p]

Baolong Pill: The word "hold" refers to nurturing. The dragon represents pure Yang energy; it corresponds to thunder and is associated with the wood of the east, symbolizing the energy of lesser Yang. When spring arrives, it marks the beginning of the emergence of all things. The character "Yi" represents the liver and wood, with the liver governing wind and embodying the image of a newborn child, which is pure Yang without Yin. The liver is characterized by excess, and the energy of lesser Yang is strong. The liver governs wind; when children are ill, they may experience heat, and heat can give rise to wind. A skilled physician considers this, creating this formula to balance the liver wood and prevent convulsions; hence, the name "hold the dragon." This medicine is essential for children to nourish their Yin and support them, ensuring balance. Furthermore, the azure dragon corresponds to the liver wood, and as children's livers often have excess while their spleens are generally deficient, this medicine curbs the liver and strengthens the spleen, thus named "hold the dragon." It treats conditions of strong heat, drowsiness with coarse breath, or coughs caused by phlegm and convulsions.

Ingredients:

  • Tianzhu Yellow: 1 qian
  • Cinnabar (Chenshi): 1 qian
  • Niu Huang (Cattle Bile): 2 fen
  • Musk: 0.5 fen
  • Pearl
  • Amber
  • Sandalwood
  • Zhi Ke (Bitter Orange Peel): 3 fen
  • Zhi Shi (Bitter Orange): 3 fen
  • Niu Dan Xing (Cattle Bile Star): 5 qian

In the twelfth month, take one cattle bile, remove the skin and navel from the southern star herb, grind it into powder, and place it inside the bile to dry in the shade for future use. Combine all to make a powder, mix with yam paste to form pills the size of yellow beans, and coat with gold foil. For tidal heat, dissolve in lantern heart tea; for convulsions, take with peppermint tea; for coughs, take with boiling water.[237p]

Liangjia Pill
This formula eliminates heat from the five organs, alleviates heart and liver fire, treats sudden fright, and resolves fetal toxins. It is effective for yellow urine, constipation, dan du (toxic rash), nosebleeds, and mouth sores.

Components:

  • Huang Lian for heart fire
  • Huang Qin for lung fire
  • Shan Zhi Ren for liver fire
  • Huang Bo for kidney fire (5 qian each)
  • Long Dan Cao for gallbladder fire (3 qian)
  • Da Huang for spleen and stomach fire
  • Xiong Huang to detoxify
  • Chen Sha to calm the heart (2 qian each)

These ingredients should be powdered, mixed with water to form pills the size of millet, and taken with bamboo leaf and lightsimmer soup. For acute fright, take with mint soup; for fetal heat, take with bamboo leaf lightsimmer soup; for nosebleeds, take with rice root soup; for dan du rash, take with Chai Hu soup; for mouth sores, take with bamboo leaf and mint soup.[238p]
