Qingzhou White Pill: Treats childhood convulsions.

Ingredients:

  • Fresh Ban Xia (Pinellia): 7 liang
  • Fresh Nan Xing (Arisaema): 3 liang
  • Fresh Bai Fu Zi (Aconite): 2 liang
  • Fresh Chuan Wu (Aconite): 0.5 liang, skin and navel removed

Preparation: Grind the above ingredients into a powder, put into a silk bag, and immerse in well water. If not released, massage by hand; if there’s residue, grind again, then place in the silk bag for proper soaking. In a magnetic basin, sun-dry by day and expose to dew by night. Discard old water by morning and mix with well water, continuing to sun-dry until the next morning. Repeat this process: five days in spring, three days in summer, seven days in autumn, and ten days in winter. After water is removed, dry and grind to a fine powder like jade, mix with glutinous rice flour to prepare porridge, form pills the size of mung beans, and take three to five pills with mint tea at any time.[288p]

　　海藏返魂丹　治小儿诸癫癎潮发瘈瘲，口眼相引，项背强直，牙关紧急，目直上视，及诸病久虚，变生虚风多睡者，因荏苒不解，速宜服之。　　乌犀屑，二两　水银　天麻酒洗焙　槟榔　硫黄研末入水银，置磁石器内慢火炒成沙　僵蚕去丝嘴微炒，各半两　白附子炮　独活　川乌　炒通赤留烟少许入碗内，以一盏子盖上，新土围之，待冷取出　干蝎去毒炙　川萆薢炒　肉桂去粗皮　当归酒浸焙干炒　细辛根　防风　天南星姜汁煮软，炒黄　阿胶杵碎炒　藿香去土　羌活　乌蛇酒浸一宿炙熟，去皮骨　沉香　槐胶　白花蛇酒浸一宿炙熟，去皮骨　麻黄去根节　半夏姜汁浸三宿炒　羚羊角镑　陈皮去白炒，各一两　天竺黄研　　木香　干姜炮　茯苓去皮　晚蚕沙微炒　人参蔓　荆子去白皮　败龟板醋酒炙黄　槁本去土　桑螵蛸炒　白芷　何首乌米泔浸一宿煮焙　虎骨酒醋涂炙黄　砂仁　白朮泔浸一宿切焙　枳壳炒去白　丁香　厚朴各三分　蝉壳炒　川芎　附子泡去皮尖　石斛去根　龙脑另研　肉豆蔻去壳炒　雄黄研飞　朱砂研飞，各一两　腻粉　麝各另研，一钱　乌鸡一只，去毛嘴翅足　狐肝三具，二味腊月入瓦器，固济煅赤，候冷研用　金箔三十片为衣　　右药五十八味，炮制如法，炼蜜合和，捣三五千下，丸如桐子大，金箔为衣，每一岁儿，温薄荷自然汁化下，无时。右阎氏宗钱氏治慢惊法，脉无力者宜之。其法以青州白丸子兼异功散、羌活膏、温白丸、钓藤饮子之类服之，至有往往死中得生者。汤氏曰：凡吐泻成虚风慢脾，先用夺命散、青州白丸子末，煎如稀糊，入蜜调，控下涎，后服袪风醒脾等药。[289p]

Soul-Returning Pill from the Sea

This pill treats various convulsions and fits in children, manifesting as pulling of the mouth and eyes, rigidity of the neck and back, tight clenching of the teeth, upward gaze, and for diseases resulting from prolonged weakness, leading to wind and excessive sleepiness. If these symptoms persist, it is advisable to take this pill promptly.

Ingredients:

  • 2 taels of powdered black rhinoceros horn
  • Mercury
  • Tianma (Gastrodia elata), washed in wine and roasted
  • Betel nut
  • Sulfur, ground into powder and mixed with mercury, then fried slowly in a magnetic vessel to form sand
  • Silkworms, with silk removed, slightly fried, each half a tael
  • White typhonium, roasted
  • Angelica, soaked in wine and roasted dry
  • Asarum (wild ginger) root
  • Siler,
  • Tian south star fried with ginger juice until soft, then fried yellow
  • Ejiao (donkey-hide gelatin), crushed and roasted
  • Patchouli (herb)
  • Qianghuo (notopterygium)
  • Black snake, soaked in wine overnight, roasted and skin and bones removed
  • Agarwood
  • Sophora gum
  • White flower snake, soaked in wine overnight, roasted and skin and bones removed
  • Ephedra, roots and joints removed
  • Pinellia with ginger juice soaked for three nights, then fried
  • Antelope horn powder
  • Aged tangerine peel, with white removed and fried
  • Wood fragrance
  • Dried ginger roasted
  • Poria (fungus) with skin removed
  • Evening silkworm sand, lightly fried
  • Ginseng vines
  • BJingzi (bitter beet) with white skin removed
  • Dried tortoise shell, roasted with vinegar
  • Dried plant roots
  • Silkworm egg, fried
  • Bai Zhi (angelica dahurica)
  • He Shou Wu (fo-ti) soaked in rice wash overnight, boiled and roasted
  • Tiger bone, treated with wine and vinegar, roasted
  • Sand cardamom
  • Atractylodes washed in rice wash overnight, cut and roasted
  • Bitter orange peel, fried with white removed
  • Cloves
  • Magnolia bark, three parts each
  • Cicada shell, fried
  • Chuanxiong (ligusticum)
  • Aconite, soaked, skin and tips removed
  • Dendrobium, roots removed
  • Camphor, separately ground
  • Nutmeg, shelled and fried
  • Realgar, ground into powder
  • Vermilion, ground into powder, one tael each
  • Grease powder
  • Musk, separately ground, one qian

One black chicken, feathers, beak, wings, and feet removed
Three fox livers; the two ingredients are added in December, compactly placed in a ceramic vessel, firmer crumbled, and ground when cooled
Thirty pieces of gold leaf as the coating

The above recipe contains fifty-eight ingredients. Prepare according to the method, combine with honey, and pound thoroughly, producing pills the size of tung seeds wrapped in gold leaf. For children, take with warm mint juice as preferred, without restriction on time. This is the method from the Yan family and the Zong family of Qian for treating prolonged fright, suitable for those with weak pulses. The method incorporates Qingzhou white pills mixed with different efficacy powders, Qianghuo ointments, warm white pills, and similar formulas, frequently rescuing from death. The Tang family states: in cases of vomiting and diarrhea leading to wind-related weakness of the spleen, first use the Fostering Life Powder, Qingzhou white pills ground into powder, boiled into a thin paste, mixed with honey and taken to control salivation, and then take other medicines to dispel wind and awaken the spleen.[289p]

　　八仙散　风盛者服之。
　　白天麻　白附子　花蛇肉　防风　南星　半夏　冬瓜子　全蝎各等分　　右(口父)咀，每服一钱，水半盏，姜二片，枣半枚，煎二分热服。加薄荷尤佳。一方加川乌。
　　酿乳方
　　人参　木香　藿香　沉香　橘皮　神曲　麦芽各等分　丁香减半　　右(口父)咀，每服四钱，水一碗，姜十片，紫苏十叶，枣三枚，煎至半碗，乳母食后，须去乳汁尽，方取服之，即仰卧霎时，令药入乳之络，次令儿吮数口，不可过饱，此良法也。如呕定一日，急宜截风，服八仙散，两日后宜醒脾散。如前件药俱用不效，危困可忧，须诊太冲脉未绝者，当灸百会一穴。前后发际两耳尖折中，乃是穴也。[290p]

Ba Xian San: For those with a strong wind condition.

Ingredients:

  • White Tianma
  • White Fuzi
  • Flower snake meat
  • Fangfeng
  • Nanking star
  • Banxia
  • Winter melon seeds
  • Whole scorpion, all in equal parts.

Directions: Grind the above ingredients, taking one qian (a unit of weight) for each dose, with half a cup of water, two slices of ginger, and half a date. Boil until it reduces to two fen (a smaller unit of measurement) and take it warm. Adding mint is even better. One recipe includes Chuanwu (a type of poisonous herb).

Nourishing Milk Recipe:
Ingredients:

  • Ginseng
  • Mu Xiang
  • Huo Xiang
  • Chen Xiang
  • Orange peel
  • Shenqu
  • Malt, all in equal parts.

Directions: Use half the amount of cloves. Grind the ingredients and take four qian per dose, with one bowl of water, ten slices of ginger, ten leaves of perilla, and three dates. Boil down to half a bowl. After the wet nurse eats, she must remove all the milk before taking it. Immediately lie on her back for a moment to let the medicine enter the milk channels, then let the baby suck a few times but do not let it become overly full; this is the correct method.

If vomiting persists for a day, it is urgent to dispel wind by taking Ba Xian San. Two days later, it is advisable to follow with Xiang Pi San. If none of the previous medicines work and there is danger, one must check the Tai Chong pulse to see if it is not completely closed and then should moxibustion on the Baihui point. The point is located at the midpoint between the hairline at the front and the tips of both ears.[290p]

方　所载但云顶上旋毛中，殊不审有双顶者，又有旋毛不正者，庸医之辈，习循旧本，悞人多矣。灸后即当控涎，用青州白丸子末，再煎如稀糊，入炼蜜，调夺命散，良久涎下；细研灵砂，米饮调，旋抹口中，渐看退证。如风盛服八仙散，昏困服醒脾散。常令减乳，母服酿乳药，如此调理，无不愈者。间有禀受不坚，五行数短者，虽神圣工巧，不能夺其造化矣。若涎已离膈，但在喉中如锯，药不能入，又不可控，当用别法撩之，兼搐鼻喷嚏得出，次服夺命散，庶免再作。[291p]

The text states that it only mentions the top of the head with spiral hair, but does not explain the existence of double tops or irregular spirals. Many mediocre physicians, adhering to old texts, often mislead people. After moxibustion, one should control saliva using a powder made from Qingzhou white pills; after simmering it to a thin paste, mix in refined honey and a lethal powder, which will eventually help salivation. Finely grind spirit sand and mix it with rice drink to apply in the mouth, gradually observing the retreat of symptoms. If there's a strong wind, take Eight Immortals Powder; if feeling drowsy, use Wake the Spleen Powder. Regularly reducing mother’s milk and having the mother take fermented milk medicine, this form of regulation leads to recovery for everyone. However, if there is a deficiency in constitution or if the five elements are imbalanced, even skilled practitioners may not overpower destiny. If the saliva has already left the diaphragm and is stuck in the throat like a saw, medications cannot enter and cannot be controlled; alternative methods must be used to stimulate its release, alongside inducing sneezing through the nose, and then taking the lethal powder to avoid recurrence.[291p]

　　撩痰方
　　川乌尖　白附尖各七个，去皮生用　蝎梢七枚　石绿少许　　右为末，一处和匀，用鸡翎蘸药，入喉中，逐渐抽出，频用帕子拭之。右汤氏治慢惊法，先用夺命散、白丸子控涎，候涎下一回，用八仙醒脾等一回，令乳母用酿乳法。如危极者，却灸百会及撩痰法，但夺命用礞石，气虚者难用，必与东垣益黄散相兼服之可也。陈氏曰：治慢惊风，先用芎蝎散，用手法斡出寒痰冷涎，自不痴呆；次服油珠膏；后服益真汤，温壮元气；时服前朴散，宽上实下。[292p]

Phlegm-Lifting Formula
Seven pieces each of Chuanwu and Baifuxin, peeled and used fresh; seven scorpions; a small amount of stone green. Grind them into a powder, mix them uniformly. Use a chicken feather to dab the medicine and insert it into the throat, gradually withdrawing it while frequently using a cloth to wipe. This is a treatment method by the Tang family for chronic fright. First, use Duoming Powder and Ba Wanzi to control phlegm, wait for the phlegm to descend once, then use Baxian to awaken the spleen again, allowing the wet nurse to use the milk fermentation method. For critical cases, one should apply moxibustion to Baihui and the phlegm-lifting method, but for Duoming, use lunstone. For those with deficient qi, it's challenging to use; must be combined with Dongyuan's Yihuang Powder. Chen said: For treating chronic fright wind, first use Xiongxie Powder to manually expel cold phlegm and cold salivation, so that one won't be delirious; then take Youzhu Ointment; afterward, take Yizhen Decoction to warm and strengthen the original qi; occasionally take the previous Pusa Powder to relieve excess above and deficiency below.[292p]

　　芎蝎散　治小儿脑髓受风，顖颅开解，皮肉筋脉急胀，脑骨缝青筋起，面少血色，或腹中气响，时便青白色沫，或呕吐痰涎，欲成慢惊，搐足胫冷者。　　川芎　荜拨各一两　半夏酒浸一宿汤洗焙　细辛各二钱　蝎梢去毒，一钱　　右细末，一周儿抄一铜钱，用数沸汤调稍热，或用薄荷汤，饥服。如痰满胸喉中，眼珠斜视，速与服。若目上直视不转睛者，难救。或痰气壅塞，不能咽药，用一指于儿喉靥腭中探入，就斡去痰涎，气稍得通；次用补脾益真汤，或以油珠膏选用。此方累世活人多矣。
　　油珠膏　治气逆呕吐，风痰作搐。
　　石亭脂硫黄中拣取如蜡者　滑石各半两　黑附炮去皮脐　半夏酒浸一宿汤洗七次焙　南星酢浸一宿，汤洗七次焙，各一钱　　右细末，每服一钱，用冷清虀汁半盏，滴麻油一点，如钱抄药，在油珠上，须臾坠下，却去虀汁，与儿服之，再用清虀汁三五口咽下，肚饥服，服讫后一时，方与乳食。[293p]

Xuanguo San treats children’s brain and marrow affected by wind, releasing pressure from the skull, and alleviating tightness in the skin, flesh, tendons, and meridians. Symptoms include bluish veins along the cranial sutures, pale complexion, occasional abdominal gas sounds, intermittent greenish-white frothy stools, or vomiting of phlegm and saliva, leading to potential chronic convulsions, with cold feet and shins.

Ingredients:

  • Chuanxiong and Bibo each 1 tael
  • Banxia soaked in wine overnight, then rinsed and roasted
  • Xixin each 2 qian
  • Scorpion tail, detoxified, 1 qian

Grind the above into a fine powder. Use a copper coin's worth for a child, mixed with some boiling water to warm it, or use mint soup, and administer on an empty stomach. If phlegm fills the chest and throat, with the eyeballs cross-eyed, administer quickly. If the eyes are fixed and unresponsive, recovery is difficult. If phlegm and gas are obstructing and ingestion of medicine is impossible, use a finger to probe into the child's throat and soft palate to remove the phlegm, allowing for slight relief. Next, use the Bushi Yizhen Decoction, or select Oil Pearl Ointment. This formula has saved many lives throughout the ages.

Oil Pearl Ointment treats reversed gas and vomiting due to wind-phlegm causing convulsions.

Ingredients:

  • Stone pavilion fat and sulfur selected to be wax-like
  • Talcum powder each 0.5 tael
  • Black Aconite, processed by removing the skin and navel
  • Banxia soaked in wine overnight, rinsed seven times and roasted
  • Southern star soaked in vinegar overnight, rinsed seven times and roasted, each 1 qian

Grind these into a fine powder. Each dose is 1 qian, mixed with half a cup of cold clear juice, adding a drop of sesame oil. Prepare the medicine on top of the oil pearls, allowing it to drop after a brief moment, then remove the clear juice and administer it to the child. Follow with three to five mouthfuls of clear juice swallowed down on an empty stomach. After one hour, then provide breast milk or food.[293p]

　　补脾益真汤　治胎弱吐乳便清而成阴癎，气逆涎潮，眼珠直视，四肢抽掣，或因变蒸客忤，及受惊误服凉药所作。　　木香　当归　人参　黄芪　丁香　陈皮　诃子　厚朴姜制　炙草　肉豆蔻　草果　白朮　桂枝　茯苓　半夏　附子炮，各半两　全蝎炒，每服加一枚　　右(口父)咀，每服三钱，水一盏半，姜一片，枣一枚，煎六分，稍热饥服。服讫令揉心腹以助药力。候一时方与乳食。渴者，加茯苓、人参、甘草、去附子、丁香、肉蔻。泻者，加丁香、诃子肉。呕吐，加丁香、半夏陈皮。腹痛者，加厚朴、良姜。欬嗽，加前胡、五味子，去附子、官桂、草果、肉蔻。足冷，加附子、丁香、厚朴。恶风自汗，加黄芪、官桂。痰喘，加前胡、枳实、赤茯，去附子、丁香、肉蔻、草果。气逆不下，加前胡、枳壳、槟榔，去当归、附子、肉蔻。腹胀，加厚朴、丁香、前胡、枳壳。[294p]

Bushi Yizhen Decoction

This remedy treats weak fetal constitution with symptoms such as vomiting milk, clear stools, and resultant infantile convulsions, reversed qi leading to excessive salivation, fixed gaze, and limb spasms. It may also arise from heat in the viscera, unexpected shocks, or improper use of cold medicines.

Ingredients include:

  • Mu Xiang (Costus)
  • Dang Gui (Angelica Sinensis)
  • Ren Shen (Ginseng)
  • Huang Qi (Astragalus)
  • Ding Xiang (Clove)
  • Chen Pi (Dried Tangerine Peel)
  • He Zi (Chebula)
  • Hou Po (Magnolia Bark, processed with ginger)
  • Zhi Gan Cao (Honey-fried Licorice)
  • Rou Dou Kou (Nutmeg)
  • Cao Guo (Amomum Fruit)
  • Bai Zhu (Atractylodes)
  • Gui Zhi (Cinnamon Twig)
  • Fu Ling (Poria)
  • Ban Xia (Pinellia)
  • Fu Zi (Prepared Aconite), each in equal amounts (four Liang each)
  • Whole scorpion (chao), one piece added per dose.

Preparation: Grind together and, per dose, take three Qian (3 grams) with one and a half Zhang (150 ml) of water, one slice of ginger, and one jujube. Boil to a reduction of two-thirds, and take while warm and slightly hungry. Afterward, massage the abdomen to reinforce the medicinal effect. Wait for an hour before consuming milk or food.

For variations:

  • For thirst: add Fu Ling, Ren Shen, and Gan Cao, removing Fu Zi, Ding Xiang, and Rou Dou Kou.
  • For diarrhea: add Ding Xiang and He Zi.
  • For vomiting: add Ding Xiang, Ban Xia, and Chen Pi.
  • For abdominal pain: add Hou Po and Liang Jiang (dried ginger).
  • For cough: add Qian Hu and Wu Wei Zi, omitting Fu Zi, Aconitum, Guo Gui, Rou Dou Kou, and Cao Guo.
  • For cold feet: add Fu Zi, Ding Xiang, and Hou Po.
  • For aversion to wind and sweating: add Huang Qi and Guo Gui.
  • For phlegm-induced wheezing: add Qian Hu, Zhi Shi, and Chi Fu Ling, removing Fu Zi, Ding Xiang, Rou Dou Kou, and Cao Guo.
  • For qi not descending: add Qian Hu, Zhi Ke, and Bing Lang, removing Dang Gui, Fu Zi, and Rou Dou Kou.
  • For abdominal distension: add Hou Po, Ding Xiang, Qian Hu, and Zhi Ke.[294p]

　　前朴散　治心腹结气，或呕哕吐泻，肚腹胀痛，惊悸。　　前胡　白朮　人参　陈皮　良姜　藿香　甘草　厚朴各等分　　右銼，每服三钱，水一盏，煎七分，稍热，空心服。
　　冲和饮　治感冒风寒，　疼发热，肩背拘急，恶心呕吐，腹痛膨胀，兼寒湿相搏，四肢拘急，冷气侵袭，腰足痛疼。　　苍朮米泔浸一宿，去粗皮銼，炒微黄，一两二钱　人参　前胡　桔梗炒，各五钱　枳壳麸炒微黄　麻黄　白芷　半夏汤洗七次姜汁浸，晒干　陈皮　川芎　甘草各七钱半　当归酒洗　薄桂去粗皮　白芍　赤茯苓去皮，各一钱半　干姜　厚朴去粗皮，姜汁浸一宿，慢火炒，各二钱　　右銼，每服二钱，水一盏，姜二片，葱一根，煎七分，无时温服。伤冷恶心呕吐，煨姜同煎。开胃进食，加枣子煎，空心温服。寒疝痛，入盐炒茱萸、蘹香同煎。[295p]

Qian Pu San: For treating inner abdominal tension related to feelings of nausea, vomiting, purging, and abdominal bloating with pain and palpitations. Ingredients: Qian Hu, Bai Zhu, Ren Shen, Chen Pi, Liang Jiang, Huo Xiang, Gan Cao, and Hou Po in equal parts. Grind into powder. Each dose is three qian, mixed with one cup of water, boiled down to seven parts, slightly warm, and taken on an empty stomach.

Chong He Yin: For treating cold-related flu symptoms, with pains, fever, tightness in the shoulders and back, nausea and vomiting, abdominal pain and bloating, combination of cold and dampness affecting limbs leading to cold invasion and pain in the lower back and feet. Ingredients: Cang Zhu, soaked in rice wash overnight, peeled and ground, lightly fried until golden, one liang two qian; Ren Shen, Qian Hu, and Jie Geng, each five qian, also fried; Zhi Ke, lightly fried until golden; Ma Huang, Bai Zhi, and Ban Xia, washed seven times with ginger juice and dried; Chen Pi, Chuan Xiong, and Gan Cao, each seven qian five fen; Dang Gui, washed with wine; thin Gui Zhi, peeled; Bai Shao and Chi Fu Ling, peeled, each one qian five fen; Gan Jiang and Hou Po, peeled, soaked in ginger juice overnight and slow-fried, each two qian. Grind into powder. Each dose is two qian, mixed with one cup of water, two slices of ginger, and one green onion, boiled down to seven parts, and taken warm at any time. For cold-induced nausea and vomiting, simmer ginger in the preparation. For appetite stimulation, add jujubes when boiling, taken warm on an empty stomach. For cold hernia pain, add salt-fried Wu Yao and Huo Xiang during boiling.[295p]

　　七宝散　治时气伤风伤寒，头昏体热咳嗽，及脾胃肺脏不和，口中腥气异常，或牙缝微有鲜血，兼调理诸病后小证得中，以其品味不僭不燥为佳。　　紫苏去老梗　香附各三两　甘草　陈皮　桔梗銼炒，各二两半　川芎　白芷各一两　　右(口父)咀，每服二钱，水一盏，姜二片，煎七分，无时温服。痰嗽，加制半夏；口腥气，入盐煎；调理诸疾，加枣子煎。

　　日生汤　治吐泻痢后，将传慢惊慢脾，神昏脉弱，饮食不进，睡露扬睛，昼轻夜重，急宜投服。　　北南星一两，瓦器盛东壁土，同醋煮，滤干銼焙　人参　冬瓜仁打碎，各五钱　　右件(口父)咀，每服二钱，水一盏半，姜三片，慢火煎七分，候温无时少与，缓投服之，急必吐。[296p]

Seven Treasures Powder treats ailments caused by seasonal changes, including colds and fevers, symptoms such as dizziness, body heat, coughing, spleen-stomach-lung disharmony, abnormal fishy breath, slight bleeding between the gums, and regulates mild symptoms of various diseases. Its properties are gentle and not too harsh. Ingredients: Purple Perilla (remove old stems), Cyperus each 3 taels, Licorice, Aged Tangerine Peel, Sterculia (lightly fried), each 2.5 taels; Chuanxiong, Bai Zhi each 1 tael. Prepare by grinding, take 2 qian each time with 1 cup of water, add 2 slices of ginger, decoct until 7 parts remain, and take warm at any time. For phlegm cough, add Ban Xia; for fishy breath, use salt for decoction; to regulate various ailments, add jujube for decoction.

Six Pillar Powder treats vomiting, diarrhea, weak stomach and spleen, cold hands and feet, and weak pulse. Ingredients: Ginseng (remove husks), White Poria (remove skin), Aconite (cooked), South Wood Fragrance, Nutmeg, Bai Zhu, each 0.5 tael. Prepare by crushing, take 2 qian each time with 1 cup of water, add 2 slices of ginger, and 1 jujube, decoct until 7 parts remain, and take warm at any time.

Sunrise Decoction treats diarrhea after vomiting, lingering slow conditions, weak spirit, and weak pulse, loss of appetite, insomnia resulting in lightness during the day and heaviness at night, requiring urgent relief. Ingredients: Bei Nanxing 1 tael, mixed with soil from the east wall in a clay pot, boil with vinegar, filter, and bake dry; Ginseng and Winter Melon Seeds, each 0.5 tael. Prepare by grinding, take 2 qian each time with 1.5 cups of water, add 3 slices of ginger, decoct slowly until 7 parts remain, wait for it to cool and take it lightly at any time, urgent cases will require vomiting.[296p]

　　固真汤　主吐泻痢后，胃虚脾慢，四肢口鼻气冷，沉困不省人事。　　人参　附子炮制　白茯苓　白朮各二钱半　山药　黄芪蜜涂炙　肉桂　甘草炙，各二钱　　右(口父)咀，每服二钱，水一盏，姜三片，枣一枚，煎七分，空心温服无时。
　　醒脾散　主醒脾养胃，止吐利，进饮食，及调理病后神昏目慢，贪睡多困，脉弱，微有痰涎，并宜投服。　　人参　白茯　藿香　白朮　甘草炙，各五钱　大南星八钱，銼作小块，纸裹，水透湿炮过用　缩砂仁四十粒　丁香四十粒，不见火　　右碎，每服二钱，水一大盏，姜三片，冬瓜子仁五十粒，捣碎，慢火煎七分，空心缓投服之，急必吐。[297p]

Gu Zhen Decoction is indicated for aftermaths of vomiting and diarrhea, with symptoms of weak stomach and spleen, coldness in the limbs and mouth, and a state of lethargy and unresponsiveness. The ingredients are: 2.5 qian each of ginseng, prepared aconite, white poria, and white atractylodes; 2 qian each of chinese yam, honey-prepared astragalus, cinnamon, and honey-fried licorice. For preparation, the ingredients should be ground, and each dosage is 2 qian with one cup of water, three slices of ginger, and one jujube, simmered until reduced to seven parts. Take warm on an empty stomach at any time.

Xing Pi San is intended to awaken the spleen and nourish the stomach, stop vomiting and diarrhea, assist in dietary intake, and regulate post-illness symptoms like confusion, lethargy, excessive sleepiness, weak pulse, and some phlegm. The ingredients are: 5 qian each of ginseng, white poria, fragrant ageratum, white atractylodes, and honey-fried licorice; 8 qian of rhizoma typhonii (cut into small pieces and wrapped in paper, soaked in water for use); 40 grains of cardamom and 40 grains of clove, not exposed to fire. For preparation, crush the ingredients; each dosage is 2 qian with one large cup of water, three slices of ginger, and 50 grains of winter melon seeds (crushed), simmered over low heat until reduced to seven parts, taken slowly on an empty stomach, and must be vomited if urgency arises.[297p]

　　沉香散　治吐利后，神昏倦怠，饮食减少，脾胃气虚，水壳不化，或随时值五心烦热，盗汗常出，或闻食恶心。　　沉香　丁香　南木香　藿香叶各二钱半　陈皮　白朮　半夏汤洗七遍姜汁制　白茯苓　肉豆蔻各五钱　粉草炙，三钱　　右除沉香、丁香、木香不过火，余七味或晒或焙，仍同三味研为细末，每服半钱至一钱，用紫苏木瓜汤，空心调服。枣汤亦好。

Chenxiang San: Treats post-vomiting and diarrhea, signs of spirit dullness and fatigue, decreased appetite, deficiency of spleen and stomach qi, undigested water retention, or feelings of heat in the heart, spontaneous sweating, or aversion to food. Ingredients: Chenxiang, Dingxiang, Nankuxiang, and Huoxiang leaves, each 2.5 qian; Chenpi, Baizhu, Banxia, washed seven times and prepared with ginger juice; Baifuling, Roudoukou, each 5 qian; Fenhao (powdered straw) roasted, 3 qian. Tianma Yin: Treats various kinds of wind seizures, leading to unconsciousness. Ingredients: Ming Tianma and Chuanwu, prepared, skin and navel removed, each 7 qian. Guanyin Quanscorpion San: Treats external wind-cold in children, internal injury to the spleen and stomach, resulting in persistent vomiting and diarrhea, leading to symptoms akin to chronic fright. Jizhou Xingpi San: Treats children's chronic fright, mental confusion, slow eyesight, and excessive phlegm. Ingredients: ginseng, white atractylodes, musk, white poria, white aconite, Gastrodia elata, fried scorpion, fried silkworm (string and mouth removed), all in equal parts. Benshi Xingpi Wan: Treats children's chronic spleen wind, caused by weakness after vomiting and diarrhea leading to lethargy and a desire for sleep, potentially resulting in wind epilepsy. Ingredients: magnolia bark, white atractylodes, sulfur boiled with tofu until bubbling, Gastrodia elata, fried scorpion, Siler, cinnamon, ginseng, each one qian. Xieshao Wan: Treats children with weak fetal qi, resulting in vomiting and diarrhea leading to wind, lethargy, and excessive sleep or twitches. Ingredients: lightly fried scorpion, broken white aconite, each half liang; sulfur processed, pinellia dry processed with ginger juice, each one liang. Grind the above into a powder, form balls the size of sesame seeds with ginger juice, take thirty balls each time, with Jingjie decoction, adjusting dosage according to the child's size.

Tianma Tang: Treats children's chronic fright wind, cold body, and convulsions. Ingredients: Gastrodia elata, Siler, black aconite, scorpion (wings and feet removed), wrapped mint leaves for stewing, and southern star. Grind the above, equal parts, and decoct for oral administration.[299p]

　　乌蝎汤　汤氏治慢惊方。
　　真川乌一枚，去皮生用　全蝎等分
　　右二件，(口父)咀，分二服，水二盏，姜一片，煎半盏，旋旋滴入口中。
　　阴癎散　阴癎即慢惊风，此能袪风豁痰，回阳正胃。　　黑附子生用去皮脐　生南星　半夏各二钱　白附子一钱半　　右研细，井水浸七日，每日换水，浸讫控干，入朱砂二钱，麝香一钱研匀，每服一字，藩荷汤调下，量儿加减。一方用生黑附子，去皮脐为末，每服二钱，以水一盏半，生姜二片，煎至半盏，分二服，量儿加减。吐者入丁香五个同煎，空心服。或水浸炊饼为丸如粟米，每服二十丸，生姜汤下亦可。
　　夏朴散
　　厚朴　半夏汤洗七次，姜汁浸半日，晒干，各一钱　　右，米泔三升同浸一百刻，水尽为度。如百刻水未尽，少加火熬干，去厚朴，只将半夏为末，每服五分或一字，薄荷汤调下，无时。[300p]

Wuxie Decoction
This is an approach proposed by the Tang clan for treating chronic fright.
Take one piece of genuine Chuan Wu (ground) and skin it, and equal parts of whole scorpion.
These two items should be ground and divided into two dosages. Add two cups of water and one slice of ginger, and simmer until half a cup remains, then slowly drip into the mouth.

Yin Xian San
Yin Xian is chronic fright wind; this can dispel wind, dissolve phlegm, and restore yang to the stomach.
Use black aconite (raw and peeled) and fresh southern star anise, each two qian; white aconite one and a half qian.
Grind these finely, soak in well water for seven days, changing the water daily. After soaking, drain, add two qian of red mercury and one qian of musk, and blend. Each dose should be taken with a certain amount of decoction, adjusted for children.
Another formula uses raw black aconite, powdered after peeling. Each dose is two qian, with one and a half cups of water and two slices of ginger, simmer until half a cup remains, to be divided into two doses, adjusted for children.
For those with vomiting, add five pieces of clove and cook together, to be taken on an empty stomach. Alternatively, make pills from water-soaked dough like corn, taking twenty pills each time, which can also be taken with ginger soup.

Xiapu Powder
Use thick bark and half summer, each soaked in soup washed seven times, and ginger juice soaked for half a day, then dried, each one qian.
Soak these in three sheng of rice wash for one hundred ke, until the water is reduced. If the one hundred ke does not reduce the water, add a little fire to dry it out. After removing the thick bark, grind only the half summer into powder. Each dosage is five fen or one qian, taken with peppermint decoction, at any time.[300p]

　　豆卷散　治小儿慢惊，多因药性太温及热药治之。有惊未退而别生热证者，有因病愈而致热证者，有反为急惊者甚多，当问病几日，因何得之，曾以何药疗之。可用解毒药，无不效，宜此方。　　大豆黄卷水浸，黑豆生芽是也，晒干　管仲　板蓝根　甘草炙，各一两　　右为末，每服半钱，水煎服，甚者三钱。药水内入油数点煎，又治吐虫，服不拘时。右诸家杂治慢惊，后一方解药太过之毒，尤见忧人之切也。
　　平肝汤　治惊而有热。
　　人参　茯苓　白芍药酒炒　白朮
　　右，入生姜煎服。暑月加黄连、生甘草，竹叶煎服。
　　朮苓汤　治小儿惊因脾虚肝乘之，手足搐动，四肢恶寒而食少。　　白朮二钱　茯苓一钱
　　右煎汤，入竹沥，热下龙荟丸三十丸，保和丸二十丸。
　　生气散
　　丁香三字　白朮　青皮各二钱　甘草炙　木香　人参各一钱　　右为末，每服半钱，沸汤点服，或用《和剂》方调气散亦可。[301p]

Dou Juan San: This is used to treat children's slow shocks, which often result from the overly warm nature of medicines and the use of heat-inducing drugs. There may be cases where the shock has not subsided but have led to the emergence of heat symptoms, or heat symptoms arise from the recovery of an illness, and there are many cases where it leads to acute shock. It is important to inquire how many days the illness has lasted, how it was contracted, and what medicines have been used for treatment. Detoxifying medicines can be used, and they are effective in all cases; this formula is recommended. Ingredients include: soaked soybean rolls, black soybean sprouts (dried), both one tael; Guanzhong, Banlangen, and licorice (roasted), each one tael. This should be ground into powder; take half a qian with water decocted each time; for more severe cases, three qians. Add a few drops of oil in the decoction to treat parasitic vomiting, and it can be taken at any time. This is a combination of treatments for slow shock; the latter formula detoxifies overly excessive toxins, particularly evident in the worried individuals.

Ping Gan Tang: This treats shock with heat. Ingredients include: ginseng, poria, white peony (wine-fried), and white atractylodes. These are added with fresh ginger and decocted for consumption. In hot months, add huanglian and sweet licorice, and use bamboo leaves for decoction.

Zhu Ling Tang: This treats children's shock caused by spleen deficiency and liver excess, manifesting as twitching of hands and feet, cold limbs, and poor appetite. Ingredients include: two qians of white atractylodes and one qian of poria. Decoct this, then add bamboo juice and heat down with thirty Dragon Huili pills and twenty Baohe pills.

Sheng Qi San: Ingredients include: three qians of clove, two qians of white atractylodes, two qians of green peel, one qian each of roasted licorice, musk, and ginseng. Grind these into powder; take half a qian with boiling water or use the prescription from "He Ji" to regulate qi, which is also acceptable.[301p]

　　演山观音全蝎散　因吐后传慢惊候，清神固气，补虚益脉，开胃止吐。　　黄芪　人参各一分　木香　炙草　莲肉炒　白扁豆炒　白茯苓　香白芷　全蝎　防风　羌活各一钱　天麻二钱　为末，每一钱，枣半个煎，无时服。慢脾尤宜服。

Yanshan Guanyin Quanxie San
Indicated for after-vomit lingering disturbances, clears the spirit and consolidates qi, nourishes deficiency and benefits the pulse, opens the appetite and stops vomiting.
Ingredients:

  • Huangqi (Astragalus) 1 fen
  • Renshen (Ginseng) 1 fen
  • Muxiang (Saussurea)
  • Zhi cao (Honey-fried Licorice)
  • Stir-fried lotus seed
  • Stir-fried white pigeon bean
  • Bai fuling (Poria)
  • Xiang baizhi (White Angelica)
  • Quanxie (Scorpion)
  • Fangfeng (Sichuan Lovage)
  • Qianghuo (Notopterygium) 1 qian each
  • Tianma (Gastrodia) 2 qian
    Grind into powder. For every 1 qian, decoct with half a jujube in water and take without specific timing. Especially suited for sluggish spleen.

Tang’s Xingspi San
Treats persistent vomiting and diarrhea, phlegm causing fright, and an appetite diminished by a troubled spleen.
Ingredients:

  • Baizhu (Atractylodes)
  • Renshen (Ginseng)
  • Zhi licorice
  • Clean aged tangerine peel
  • Bai fuling (Poria)
  • Detoxified Quanxie (Scorpion) each 5 qian
  • Banxia (Pinellia) and Muxiang (Saussurea) 1 fen each
  • Biaofu (Convolvulus) 4 pieces, fried
  • Nanshen (Southern Star) 1 piece, fried
  • Chen cang rice 200 grains
    Grind all into powder. For each dose, take 1 qian with half a cup of water, 2 slices of ginger, and half a jujube, decocting and taking at intervals.

Da Xingspi San
Used to treat internal deficiency of the wind in a sluggish spleen, leading to confusion and fogginess.
Ingredients:

  • Renshen (Ginseng)
  • Fulig (Poria)
  • Fried Muxiang (Saussurea)
  • Roasted Quanxie (Scorpion)
  • Shilian meat
  • Baizhu (Atractylodes)
  • Aged tangerine peel
  • Sand cardamom
  • Zhi licorice
  • Cloves
  • Fried Biaofu (Convolvulus) each in equal parts
  • A pinch of aged rice, roasted
    Grind into coarse powder. For each dose, take 2 qian with a cup of water, 3 slices of fresh ginger, and a jujube, decoct until reduced by a fifth, taking without specific timing. Adjust the amount based on age and size.[302p]

Shipi San: Treats spleen and stomach deficiency with coldness, continuous vomiting and diarrhea, inability to digest milk and food, and symptoms of chronic spleen.

Ingredients:

  • Ginseng
  • White Poria
  • White Atractylodes
  • Amomum

  • Honey-fried Licorice

Crush these into a fine powder. Each dose is half a qi or one qi, taken with rice soup at any time. The above are the main herbs for chronic spleen wind.

Baoming Dan: Treats acute and chronic convulsions in children, reversed coldness in the limbs, fixed eyes and closed mouth, and excessive salivation.

Ingredients:

  • One pair of tiger's eyes
  • Cover on a new tile, then seal with another tile, and dry slowly over low heat
  • Half a tael of Cinnabar
  • Half a money of Whole Scorpion
  • Half a money of Musk
  • One fen of Gastrodia
  • Two Centipedes, heads and tails removed, the red-footed ones

Crush these into a fine powder, mix into honey and form into pills the size of soybeans, store in a clay jar, and further add musk for preservation.

For acute convulsions, dissolve three pills in mint honey soup; for chronic convulsions, dissolve three pills in mint soup.[303p]

Zhenjing Pill

Ingredients:

  • Amber: 2.5 qian
  • Cinnabar: 2.5 qian
  • Mother of pearl: 2.5 qian
  • Qingpi: 2.5 qian
  • Licorice: 2.5 qian
  • Qindai: 5 liang
  • Aloe: 5 liang
  • Chaihu: 5 liang
  • Qingmangshi Nitrate: 5 liang
  • Tianzhuhuang: 2 liang
  • Danxing: 2 liang
  • Tianma: 1 liang
  • Frankincense: 1 liang
  • Xionghuang: 1.5 qian

Grind the above ingredients into a fine powder. Mix with licorice extract to form pills the size of a chickpea. Administer with a decoction of ginseng and atractylodes for mild convulsions, and with a decoction of mint, ginger, and honey for urgent convulsions.

Chensha Pills
For children’s urgent and chronic convulsions:

Ingredients:

  • 49 whole scorpions, lightly roasted
  • Cinnabar: 0.5 liang
  • Ground into a very fine powder

Take 10 cleaned earthworms, place in a small bottle, and use gentle heat to transform them into liquid. Mix and form pills the size of a peppercorn. Take three pills each time, dissolved in water.

For children’s urgent and chronic convulsions:

Ingredients:

  • Three roasted silkworms
  • Cinnabar: the size of a bean
  • One roasted whole scorpion
  • A pinch of powdered mother of pearl

Grind the above into fine powder. For small insects found in mugwort, form each into a pill the size of a sesame seed, and take each with milk.[304p]

　　琥珀抱龙丸　专治小儿急慢惊风，发热咳嗽，作搐，痰喘惊悸，生姜薄荷汤下。　　琥珀二钱半，包在精猪肉内煨过，取出研末，二钱　牛胆南星一两六钱，腊月用牛胆制作成者妙　僵蚕二钱，炒　雄黄研　辰砂研飞　人参　白茯苓各三钱　天竺黄五钱　真牛黄五分　钓藤全用钩子，一两五钱　真麝香一钱　　右各味不可短少分厘，碾为极细末，用粉甘草八两銼碎，以水四大碗熬膏二盏，入药末为丸，每一丸重五分，金箔为衣，外用黄蜡包之，一料作二百丸。时行痘疹，发热呕吐惊跳，白汤下；伤风发热，咳嗽鼻塞，惊哭，葱汤下。因着惊发热，睡卧不宁，灯心汤下；夏月发热呕吐，麦门冬汤下；因母发热过乳，温热不宁，甘草汤下；脾胃不和，头热，黄瘦懒食，砂仁汤下。周岁小儿服一丸，未及者半丸。连进一二丸，无不效验。忌食鱼腥生冷。食乳者乳母同服。　　又　治病法如前。[305p]

Amber Dragon Pill is specifically used to treat children's acute and chronic convulsions, fevers, coughs, spasms, phlegm, wheezing, and palpitations, to be taken with ginger and mint decoction.

Ingredients include: 2.5 taels of amber, steamed with finely minced pork, ground into a powder; 1.6 taels of cow bile from cattle processed in the twelfth lunar month; 2 taels of silkworms, fried; 3 taels each of realgar and cinnabar, ground finely; 3 taels of ginseng; 3 taels of white poria; 5 taels of tian zhu huang; 0.5 tael of genuine cow bile; 1.5 taels of wisteria; 1 tael of genuine musk.

All ingredients must be measured precisely and ground to a very fine powder. Use 8 taels of powdered licorice, boil with 4 large bowls of water until reduced to 2 bowls of syrup, then mix in the powdered herbs to form pills, each weighing 0.5 taels, coated in gold leaf and wrapped in yellow wax. This formula makes 200 pills in total.

For childhood illnesses such as measles, fever, vomiting, and convulsions, use with light broth; for wind-cold with fever, cough, stuffy nose, and crying, use with scallion broth; for fever-induced insomnia, use with light heart-wick broth; for summer heat with vomiting, use with ophiopogon decoction; for maternal fever affecting nursing, use with licorice decoction; if there’s disharmony of spleen and stomach, heat, laziness, and lack of appetite, use with cardamom broth.

Children aged one year may take one pill, and younger children half a pill. Administer one or two pills consecutively, and they will all be effective. Avoid raw or cold fish. Nursing mothers should take it as well.

Additionally, the method for treating illness is as mentioned above.[305p]

　　琥珀一两半，研　牛黄一钱，研　人参　檀香　白茯苓各一两半　朱砂研　珍珠各五钱，研　枳壳炒　枳实　牛胆南星　天竺黄各一两　山药十两　甘草三两。以上各为细末再用　金箔四百片　蜂蜜二斤　黄蜡二十五斤　此药一料五百丸，每丸重五分。专治婴孩小儿诸惊，四时感冒，瘟疫邪热，烦噪不宁，痰嗽气急，疮疹欲出，发搐，并皆治之。其药性温平，不寒不躁，驱风化痰，镇心解热，安魂定惊，和脾健胃，添益精神。葱白煎汤，或薄荷汤下。痰壅咳甚，生姜汤下；痘疹见形有惊，白汤下；心悸不安、灯心汤下，并不拘时服。初生数月者，每丸作四次服，或三分之一，或半丸；数岁者每服一丸。更量儿大小加减酌用可也。[306p]

One and a half taels of amber, ground; one cash of cow bile, ground; one and a half taels each of ginseng, sandalwood, and white poria; five cash each of ground cinnabar and pearl; one tael each of fried bitter orange peel, bitter orange, buffalo gall, south star, and amber; ten taels of Chinese yam; three taels of licorice. All of the above should be finely powdered. Then use four hundred pieces of gold leaf, two jin of honey, and twenty-five jin of yellow wax. This remedy yields five hundred pills, each weighing five fen. It is specifically designed to treat various infantile convulsions, seasonal ailments, epidemic diseases, heat and agitation, phlegm cough with difficult breathing, early-stage rashes, and spasms. The properties of this medicine are warm and mild, not cold or overly stimulating; it dispels wind, transforms phlegm, calms the heart, alleviates heat, settles the spirit, harmonizes the spleen, strengthens the stomach, and enhances vitality. It can be taken with scallion decoction or mint tea. For excessive phlegm and severe coughing, use ginger tea; for emerging rashes accompanied by agitation, use clear soup; for heart palpitations and restlessness, use lamb's heart tea, without regard to timing. For infants in their first few months, each dose should be divided into four parts, or one-third or half a pill; for toddlers, one pill per dose. Adjust the dosage according to the child's size as necessary.[306p]

　　夺命散　治急慢惊风诸药无效，此药随手奏功。　　白附三钱　黑附炮去皮脐，半两，急惊不用　南星炮，一两　天麻三钱　辰砂另研，二钱半　防风　半夏各半两　全蝎七枚　蜈蚣炙，一条　麝香半钱　僵蚕炒，慢惊不用　　右为末，三岁儿半钱，薄荷生姜自然汁，加好酒沸汤，各少许调服。急惊加轻粉、脑子各少许。

　　赤脚蜈蚣酒炙，一全条　白直僵蚕炒，七个　辰砂另研，一字　全蝎用薄荷叶包炙，七枚　青州白丸子三十枚　　右为末，入麝香少许，慢惊人参麦门冬汤调下；急惊加脑子、牛黄各少许，金银薄荷汤下。
　　天麻散　治小儿急慢惊风。

Yuanming Powder: Effective for both urgent and chronic fright ailments when other medicines fail. The preparation consists of: 3 qian of white fu, half a liang of black fu (skinned and roasted, no need for urgent fright), 1 liang of southern star (roasted), 3 qian of tianma, 2.5 qian of mercury (ground separately), half a liang each of fangfeng and banxia, 7 whole scorpions, 1 roasted centipede, and half a qian of musk. For chronic fright, use stir-fried silkworms.

Grind these ingredients into a powder. For a child aged three, mix half a qian of this powder with fresh mint and ginger juice, combined with a little good wine and hot broth. For urgent fright, add a little light powder and brain matter.

Baosheng Pill: Highly effective for treating chronic fright. The preparation consists of: 1 whole roasted centipede, 7 stir-fried silkworms, a single character of mercury ground separately, 7 whole scorpions wrapped in mint leaves and roasted, and 30 white balls from Qingzhou. Grind these into a powder, add a little musk, and for those with chronic fright, mix it with ginseng and maidong soup; for urgent fright, add a little brain matter and niuhuang, then combine with golden silver mint soup.

Tianma Powder: Treats children's urgent and chronic fright ailments. Ingredients include: 7 qian of banxia, 2.5 qian of tianma, and 3 qian each of roasted licorice, fu ling, and bai zhu.

Use 1 cup of water, cook the medicine in a ceramic pot until the water dries, and then add 3 qian of old ginger while cooking until it dries to form a fine powder. Each dose is 1 qian and 5 fen, mixed with ginger and jujube broth for administration.[307p]

　　雄黄散　主暴中急慢惊风，齁(鼻合)痰涎满口，及雨侵闭，汗不通，或凉或热，坐卧生烦。　　红亮雄黄二钱半　白勺　川乌头炮去皮脐　草乌头炮去皮　明天麻　川芎各半两　　右除雄黄外，五味銼焙，同雄黄为末，惊风痰涌，每服半钱或一钱，用姜汁茶清调下。发汗，姜葱薄荷水煎。并投三服取效。
　　南星散　治惊风坠涎。
　　天南星一个，重一两者，换酒浸七周时取出，新瓦上炭火炙干烈，地上去火毒，捣细末，入朱砂二钱半　　右研为细末，每服五分，荆芥汤，空心及午时各调下一服。
　　天麻防风丸　治小儿惊风身热，喘粗多睡，惊悸搐掣神昏，痰涎不利等证。　　天麻　防风　人参各一两　蝎尾去毒，半两　甘草　朱砂　雄黄　牛黄　麝香各一钱　僵蚕炒，半两　　右为末，炼蜜丸如樱桃大，朱砂为衣，每服薄荷汤下一二丸。[308p]

Xionghuang San: This formula is for treating acute seizure with swift onset, tumultuous phlegm filling the mouth, and afflictions caused by rain, causing blockage of sweat, alternating between cold and heat, leading to restlessness while sitting or lying down.

Ingredients:

  • Xionghuang (Realgar) 2.5 qian
  • Bai Sha (White Spoon)
  • Chuan Wutou (Aconite) processed, peeled and with pit removed
  • Cao Wutou (Aconite) processed and peeled
  • Ming Tianma (Gastrodia)
  • Chuan Xiong (Sichuan Lovage) each 5 qian.

Preparation: Excluding Xionghuang, grind the other five ingredients together, then mix them with Xionghuang into a fine powder. For phlegm-induced seizures, take 0.5 qian or 1 qian each time, mixed with ginger juice and tea. For sweating, brew with ginger, green onion, and mint. Administer in three doses for effect.

Nanxing San: This treats seizures with drooling.

Ingredients:

  • Acanthopanax (Tian Nan Xing), one that weighs one liang, soaked in wine for seven weeks, then taken out. Fire-roast on a new tile until dry and intensely hot, crush it into a fine powder, and mix with 2.5 qian of vermilion.

Preparation: Grind into a fine powder, take 0.5 qian each time, mixed with a decoction of schizonepeta (Jingjie) at empty stomach and at noon, each time adjusting the dose accordingly.

Tianma Fangfeng Wan: This treats pediatric seizures, fever, wheezing, excessive sleeping, fright, spasms, confusion, and phlegm obstruction.

Ingredients:

  • Tianma (Gastrodia)
  • Fangfeng (Siler)
  • Ren Shen (Ginseng), each one liang
  • Scorpion tail, detoxified, 0.5 liang
  • Licorice, Vermilion, Realgar, Niu Huang (Bovine Gallstone), Musk each 1 qian
  • Fried silkworms, 0.5 liang

Preparation: Grind into a powder, refine into honey pills the size of cherries, coated with vermilion. Each dose to be taken with mint tea, 1 to 2 pills at a time.[308p]

　　七味羌活膏　治急慢惊风壮热。
　　羌活　独活　明天麻　全蝎去毒　人参　僵蚕炒，各半两　乌蛇肉酒浸一宿焙干，一两　　右为末，炼蜜和丸如皂子大，每两作五十丸，每服一丸，荆芥汤下。

Seven-Herb Qianghuo Ointment treats acute and chronic convulsions with fever.

Ingredients:

  • Qianghuo, Du Huo, Ming Tian Ma, Whole Scorpion (processed to remove toxins), Ginseng, and Jiang Can (fried), each 0.5 taels.
  • One tael of dried, alcohol-soaked black snake meat.

Grind the above into a powder, refine with honey to form pills the size of soap. From each two taels, make fifty pills. Take one pill with Jing Jie decoction.

Whole Scorpion Powder treats children's convulsions.

Ingredients:

  • Two qian of Whole Scorpion, not removing head and tail, dry roasted wrapped in thin river leaves.

Grind into a powder, make four doses, and take with white decoction.

Bian Yin Pill treats children's acute and chronic convulsions with accumulation.

Ingredients:

  • Three qian of Qing Dai, one bean-sized amount of mercury, combined with roasted black lead and cold food flour, and roasted yellow gelatin powdered, each two qian.
  • A small amount of brain musk, light powder (fried), a bean-sized portion, and one tael each of Xiong Huang, Fen Shuang, and Zhu Sha, along with twenty-one seeds of Ba Dou (oil removed).

Grind finely, form pills the size of sesame seeds, shape and dry, stored in a ceramic box. Administer one pill annually, adjusting as necessary, taken with jujube decoction, ensuring it does not dissolve.[309p]

　　劫风膏　治急慢惊搐，脐风撮口，牙关紧闭，疼涎壅盛，咽喉肿痛。　　葳灵仙去芦，一两半，细銼焙干为末　　右用皂荚三两，去皮弦捶挪，温水一碗，绢滤过，慢火熬若稀糊，入醇醋半两，再熬三五沸，去火候冷，用前药末停分乳钵内杵匀，丸芡实大。先用盐梅肉擦牙根；次以此膏一丸或二丸，温白汤浓调，抹入左右牙关内即开；续进别药。熬时得瓦器为上，银器尤佳。如解风痰壅盛，淡姜汤调化，无时少与含咽。咽喉肿痛，温茶清调下或溥荷汤。以上诸方，通治急慢惊风。盖谓虚实两见，急慢互出，故有通治之法。合而言之，急慢虽异，皆本之于痰，故礞石、星、半之属，通能治之者也。分而言之，礞石之属泻痰，青黛之属泻木，朱砂之属泻火，皆治气实之剂；参、草之属补土，天麻、全蝎之属补木，乌、附之属补火，又皆治气虚之剂，故补泻兼施，虚实通治之法也。[310p]

Jiefeng Gao

This remedy treats both acute and chronic wind-induced convulsions, umbilical wind that causes mouth spasms, clenched jaws, excessive pain and saliva, and swollen, painful throats.

Ingredients:

  • Wei Ling Xian (Some type of herb, 1.5 taels), finely ground and roasted until dry.

Preparation:

  • Use 3 taels of soap pod, remove the skin and strings, pound it, and then mix with one bowl of warm water. Filter through silk, and simmer over low heat until it becomes a thin paste.
  • Add half a tael of strong vinegar, simmer for another three to five boils, remove from heat, cool it down, and mix the prepared herbal powder evenly in a mortar, forming pills the size of a chestnut.
  • First, rub the roots of the teeth with salt and plum meat; then take one or two pills, mix with warm, concentrated white soup, and apply into both sides of the jaws until they open; continue with other medicines.

Note: When boiling, the use of earthenware is preferred; silver is even better. For phlegm stagnation, use light ginger soup for dissolution, administered at any time. For swollen and painful throat, drink warm tea or light lotus leaf soup.

These methods are effective for treating both acute and chronic wind conditions, addressing both deficiency and excess, hence the method for universal treatment. In summary, despite the distinctions between acute and chronic, both stem from phlegm, thus remedies related to stones, stars, and half can universally treat the conditions.

When it comes down to specifics, substances related to stones help eliminate phlegm, those with indigo relieve wood-related blockages, and cinnabar addresses fire-related issues, all are effective against Qi stagnation. Ginseng and licorice help tonify the earth, while Tianma and whole scorpion nourish wood, and black and Aconite root nourish fire; all serve to remedy Qi deficiency. Therefore, a combination of reinforcement and draining is effective in treating both deficiency and excess.[310p]

Thunder Dispersing Powder (from the 'Proof and Treatment Principles')
For sudden or chronic convulsions leading to loss of consciousness:

  • Pig's tooth soapwort: 3 qian
  • Asarum: 2 qian
  • Chuanxiong: 2 qian
  • Bai zhi: 2 qian
  • Rhododendron flower: 1.5 qian

Ba Wu Ding Zhi Wan: This formula supplements the heart and spirit, stabilizes the soul, eliminates phlegm, dispels internal heat from the chest, regulates the lungs and kidneys, and treats fevers caused by shock.

Ingredients:

  • 2 taels of ginseng
  • 1 tael each of sweet flag (Acorus calamus), and fu shen (Poria root),
  • 1 tael each of poria and some red mercury ground with water (2 qian)

  • 2 qians of niuhuang (cattle bile), ground separately.

If lung qi is insufficient, add almond, ophiopogon, and schisandra. If heart qi is insufficient, add party ginseng, fu shen, and sweet flag. If spleen qi is insufficient, add white atractylodes, white peony, and bayberry seeds. If kidney qi is insufficient, add cooked rehmannia, polygala, and peony root. If gallbladder qi is insufficient, add asarum, sour jujube seed, and ground earth. If spirit is dim, add red mercury, pre-watching seeds, and fu shen.

Zi He Che Wan: This tonic is for treating epilepsy.

Prepare one ziheche (cordyceps) in a fleshy form, clean it, then steam it in broth until it becomes soft and mix it with 2 taels each of ginseng and angelica to make a powder. Form this mixture into pills the size of water chestnuts, taking five to seven pills each time, dissolved in milk.[316p]

　　独活汤　治小儿风癎，解表通里。

Cinnabar, ground without specific measure.

Hupo Shouxing Pills: One piece of Dannanxing (a medicinal herb), dug and calcined in a fire pit with clean red charcoal. Four taels of amber and two and a half taels of Zhusha are used as a coating. Form jujube-sized pills from the mixture using pig heart blood; take fifty pills with ginseng decoction.[321p]

　　沉香天麻汤　治小儿因惊成癎，发搐，痰涎壅塞，目多白睛，项背强急，喉中有声，神思如痴，先灸两蹺脉各二七壮。　　沉香　益智　川乌炮去皮脐，各二钱　天麻　防风　半夏汤泡　附子炮去皮脐，各三钱　羌活五钱　甘草炙　当归　姜屑各一钱半　独活四钱　　右(口父)咀，每服五钱，生姜三片，水煎温服。举痛论云：恐则气下，精怯而上焦闭。又云：从下上者，引而去之。以羌活、独活苦温味之薄者，阴中之阳，引气上行，又入太阳之经为引用，故以为君。天麻、防风辛温以散之，当归、甘草辛甘温以补气血之不足，又养胃气，故以为臣。黑附子、川乌头、益智仁大辛温，行阳退阴，又治寒客伤胃为佐。肾主液入脾为涎，以生姜、半夏燥湿化痰。十剂云重可去怯，沉香辛温，体重气清，去怯安神，故以为使。气味相合，升阳补胃，恐怯之气，自得平矣。[324p]

Agarwood and Tianma Decoction: This is used to treat children who develop convulsions due to fright, manifesting as spasms, phlegm blockage, excessive whites of the eyes, tense neck and back, sound in the throat, and a dazed demeanor. First, perform moxibustion on the two Qiao vessels with 27 warm sticks each.

Ingredients:

  • Agarwood
  • Job's Tears
  • Prepared Chuanwu (black aconite) with skin and navel removed, each 2 qian
  • Tianma
  • Fangfeng
  • Banxia soaked in decoction
  • Fuzi (prepared aconite) with skin and navel removed, each 3 qian
  • Qianghuo 5 qian
  • Honey-fried Licorice
  • Angelica
  • Shredded ginger, each 1.5 qian
  • Du Huo 4 qian

For preparation: Grind the above into a fine powder. For each dose, take 5 qian of the powder, add 3 slices of fresh ginger, and decoct with water to take warm.

According to the Treatise on Pain: Fear causes qi to descend, leading to weakness of essence and blockage of the upper jiao. It is said: "What ascends from below should be drawn out." The Qianghuo and Du Huo are slightly warm and bitter, which helps to raise the yang and promote ascending qi, entering the Taiyang meridian. Therefore, they are designated as the monarch herbs. Tianma and Fangfeng are spicy and warm, which disperse, while Angelica and Licorice are spicy, sweet, and warm, replenishing the deficiency of qi and blood, and nourishing the stomach qi, hence they are designated as minister herbs. Black Aconite, Chuanwu, and Job's Tears are very spicy and warm, promoting yang and expelling yin, also treating cold damage to the stomach, acting as assistants. The kidneys govern fluids and enter the spleen as phlegm, hence fresh ginger and Banxia are used to dry dampness and transform phlegm. The ten doses proposed can remove fear, and Agarwood is spicy and warm, heavy in nature, clearing qi, dispelling fright, thus it is designated as the envoy herb. The harmonious combination of flavors raises the yang and nourishes the stomach, calming the qi of fear, restoring balance.[324p]

　　牛黄丸　治因惊中风，五癎天钓，客忤潮涎灌壅。　　白花蛇肉　白附　全蝎　生川乌半两者，一枚　天麻　薄荷叶各半两，已上六味，先为细末，次入雄黄五两　辰砂　牛黄各三钱　脑子半两　麝香一钱　　右为一处和匀，麻黄去根二两，酒一升，煎麻黄至一盏，去麻黄，用酒熬药得所，勿至焦赤，众手疾丸如芡实大，密器盛之。一丸作五服，煎金银薄荷汤磨化，大能发散驾邪。[325p]

Niu Huang Wan treats strokes caused by fright, convulsions from fright, and congestion due to counteracting tidal saliva.

Ingredients:

  • White flower snake meat
  • White Atractylodes
  • Whole scorpion
  • Half a tael of raw Chuanwu (black and white)
  • One piece of Tianma (Gastrodia elata)
  • Half a tael of mint leaves

First, grind the above six ingredients into a fine powder. Then, add five taels of realgar and three qian each of cinnabar and niu huang (cattle bile), along with half a tael of brain matter and one qian of musk.

Mix these thoroughly. Use two taels of ephedra, removed from its roots, and one sheng of wine. Boil the ephedra until reduced to one cup, then remove the ephedra and boil the medicine in the wine until well combined, but do not let it burn.

Form pills the size of fox nuts and store them in a sealed container. One pill makes five doses, which can be prepared with gold, silver, or mint tea for effective dispersion against evil.[325p]

　　治五癎得效方
　　露蜂房焙　石绿各一两　桂心　远志去心　人参各半两　朱砂一钱　　右为末，粥丸如桐子大，每服二三十丸，白汤下。
　　生地黄连汤　治血脱，寻衣撮空，摇头妄语。　　川芎　生地　当归各七钱　赤芍　栀子　黄芩　黄连各三钱　防风一钱五分　　右，每服三钱，水煎服。

　　大青膏
　　天麻末，一方　生白附末，一钱半　青黛一钱，研　生蝎尾末　乌梢蛇肉酒浸焙干末，各半钱　朱砂研　　右同再研细，生蜜和成膏，每服半皂子大至一皂子大。月中儿粳米大，同牛黄膏温薄荷水化一处服之。五岁已上，同甘露散服之。
　　镇心丸　凉心经，治惊热痰盛。
　　甜硝白者　人参去芦取末，各一两　甘草炙　寒水石烧，各一两半　干山药　白茯苓各二两　朱砂一两　龙脑　麝香各一钱，三味俱另研　　右为末，熟蜜丸如鸡豆大。如要红，入坯子胭脂二钱。温水化下半丸至一二丸，食后服。一方用金箔为衣。[326p]

Formula for Treating Epilepsy

  1. Ingredients:

    • Honeycomb (dried) - 2 taels
    • Stone green (malachite) - 2 taels
    • Cinnamon heart (cassia) - 0.5 tael
    • Root of distant aspirations - 0.5 tael (remove heart)
    • Ginseng - 0.5 tael
    • Cinnabar - 1 qian

    Preparation: Grind the above into a powder, form into pills the size of a tung seed. Take 20-30 pills with white decoction.

  2. Sheng Di Huang Lian Decoction: Used for treating blood loss, seeking clothing, muttering nonsense.

    • Chuan Xiong - 0.7 taels
    • Sheng Di (Rehmannia) - 0.7 taels
    • Dang Gui (Angelica) - 0.7 taels
    • Red Peony - 0.3 taels
    • Gardenia - 0.3 taels
    • Huang Qin (Scutellaria) - 0.3 taels
    • Huang Lian (Coptis) - 0.3 taels
    • Fang Feng (Saposhnikovia) - 0.15 tael

    Preparation: Take 3 qian of this mixture, decoct with water.

Da Qing Ointment

  1. Ingredients:

    • Tian Ma (Gastrodia) powder - 1 portion
    • Bai Fu (white typhonium) powder - 1.5 qian
    • Indigo - 1 qian, ground
    • Tail of live scorpion powder - 0.5 qian
    • Dried end of black snake meat soaked in wine - 0.5 qian
    • Cinnabar, ground

    Preparation: Grind all finely together, mix with raw honey into an ointment. Take half the size of a soap piece up to a whole soap piece. For children at the mid-month size of glutinous rice, dissolve with mint water. For those aged five and above, take with sweet dew powder.

Zhen Xin Pills: Cools the heart meridian, treats startled heat and phlegm excess.

  1. Ingredients:

    • Sweet nitrate (white) - Ginseng, stripped of husk, ground - 2 taels
    • Licorice, roasted - 1.5 taels
    • Cold water stone, burned - 1.5 taels
    • Dried yam - 2 taels
    • White Poria - 2 taels
    • Cinnabar - 1 tael
    • Dragon brain (camphor) - 1 qian
    • Musk - 1 qian, ground separately

    Preparation: Grind all into a powder, mix with cooked honey into pills the size of a chickpea. If red is desired, add 2 qian of cosmetic powder. Dissolve half a pill to one or two pills with warm water after meals. Another formula uses gold leaf as a coating.[326p]

　　大防风汤　治鹤膝风肿痛不消，或溃而不敛。　　附子炮　牛膝酒炒各一钱　白朮　羌活　人参　防风各二钱　杜仲姜制　川芎　肉桂　黄芪炒　熟地黄自制　芍药炒，各一钱五分　甘草一钱　　右，每服三五钱，水煎，仍量儿大小用之。

Da Fangfeng Decoction: Treats swelling and pain from "Crane Knee Wind" that does not subside, or ulcers that fail to heal. Ingredients: Processed Aconite, Chuan Niu Xi, Bai Zhu, Qiang Huo, Ren Shen, Fang Feng (each two qian), Du Zhong (prepared with ginger), Chuan Qiong, Rou Gui, Huang Qi (roasted), Shu Di Huang (prepared), and Shao Yao (roasted), each one qian and five fen; Gan Cao one qian. Dosage: Each time take three to five qian, decoct in water, adjusting quantity for children.

Du Huo Ji Sheng Decoction: Ingredients include Du Huo, Sang Ji Sheng, Du Zhong (fried), Xi Xin, Chuan Niu Xi (fried with wine), Qin Jiao, Fu Ling, Bai Shao (fried), Gui Xin, Chuan Qiong, Fang Feng, Gan Cao, Ren Shen, Shu Di Huang, and Dang Gui, all in equal parts. Dosage: Each time take two to three qian, decoct in water on an empty stomach, and lactating mothers may take the same.

Fang Ji Decoction: Treats wind and dampness from colds, failing to release the exterior, causing flowing pain in both legs, swelling of the knees, inability to bend or stretch, leading to paralysis. Ingredients: Ma Huang (without joints, keeping roots, completely effective for both interior and exterior), crushed and soaked in soup, filtered and dried; Fang Ji (removing black skin), and thin Gui (removing rough skin), each half liang; Chi Shao, Cang Zhu soaked overnight in rice wash, removing rough skin and filtering before frying until slightly yellow; Chi Fu Ling, each one liang; Gan Cao (roasted), seven qian and five. Dosage: Each time take two qian, with one cup of water, two slices of ginger, one green onion, decoct until reduced to seven parts, taken hot on an empty stomach, or combined with Xiang Bai for decoction.[327p]

　　袪风散　治卒暴中风，不能言全，口眼喎斜，惊瘫搐掣，痰实烦躁，神昏有热，睡卧不稳。　　防风　生南星　生甘草　　半夏如前法制　黄芩各一两　　右碎，每服二钱，水一盏半，姜三片，慢火煎七分，不拘时温服。
　　独活汤　治惊瘫鹤膝，及中风湿日久，致腰背手足疼痛，昼轻夜重，及四肢痿痹不仁。　　川独活黄色如鬼眼者，佳半两　当归酒洗　白朮　蜜黄芪　薄桂　川牛膝酒洗，各二钱半　甘草炙，三钱　　右件(口父)咀，每服二钱，水一盏，姜二片，薤白一分，煎七分，空心热服。或无时。[328p]

Wind-Dispelling Decoction: For treating sudden apoplexy (stroke) where the patient cannot speak clearly, with slurred speech and facial droop, sudden paralysis and spasms, thick phlegm causing agitation, feverish confusion, and unstable sleep.
Ingredients:

  • 1.5 grams of Fangfeng (Siler),
  • 1.5 grams of Baihuasheng (Rhizoma Arisaematis),
  • 1.5 grams of Licorice (Gancao),
  • 1.5 grams of Banxia (Pinellia),
  • 1.5 grams of Huangqin (Scutellaria), each.
    Crush the ingredients and take 6 grams each time, with 1.5 cups of water, and 3 slices of ginger, simmer on low heat until reduced by a third, and take warm at any time.

Duhuo Decoction: For treating sudden paralysis of the "crane knee" (knee joint), and chronic wind-damp causing pain in the waist, back, and limbs, with symptoms that are lighter during the day and heavier at night, including lethargy and numbness in the limbs.
Ingredients:

  • 15 grams of Chuan Duhuo (Angelica pubescens), preferably yellow as a ghost's eye,
  • 15 grams of Danggui (Angelica sinensis), washed with wine,
  • 15 grams of Baizhu (Atractylodes),
  • 15 grams of Huangqi (Astragalus),
  • 15 grams of Rougui (Cinnamon),
  • 15 grams of Chuan Niuxi (Achyranthes), also washed with wine,
  • 9 grams of Licorice (Gancao) roasted.
    Crush these ingredients and take 6 grams each time, with 1 cup of water, 2 slices of ginger, and 1 piece of Chinese chives, and simmer on low heat until reduced by a third. Take warm on an empty stomach, or at any time.[328p]

Black Tiger Pill: Treats various wind disorders.

Ingredients:

  • 1 tael of black skin removed from Aconitum kusnezoffii
  • 1 tael of black skin removed from Aconitum carmichaelii
  • 7.5 qian each of honey-fried licorice, ephedra, sweet pine, cooked rehmannia, patchouli leaves, white peony, oil smoke ink (burned), pig’s tooth soap, Sichuan lovage, angelica, fleawort, red beans, fresh nux vomica, silkworms, notopterygium, white frankincense, half a tael each of water tortoise (oil removed).

Method: Grind the above into fine powder, mix with glutinous rice flour to make a paste, and form pills the size of a sesame seed. Take 30, 50, or 70 pills, slightly on an empty stomach, using light ginger soup. For children, make pills the size of millet and use the same method.

Wind Releasing Decoction: Treats wind stroke with symptoms such as wild speech, loss of voice, spiritual confusion, fainting, and other related signs; also useful for patients recovering from swelling who may feel an external wind sensation, manifesting as general weakness and floating symptoms.

Ingredients:

  • Half a tael each of white peony skin, stir-fried atractylodes, white peony root, thin cinnamon, saposhnikovia, Sichuan lovage, angelica (washed in wine), honey-fried licorice, and peeled apricot kernels;
  • 7.5 qian each of Sichuan notopterygium and ephedra (roots removed).

Method: For each dose, take 2 qian, add to a cup of water, with two slices of ginger, decocting to about 70% remaining volume, and take warm at any time.[329p]

For treating all types of phlegm, coughing, fright, and acute fright with phlegm, even in cases of impending death; if administered, it will bring back to life instantly.

Li Jing Wan: Treats sudden fright and wind in the navel, causing a stiff tongue.
Ingredients: Five qian of Banxia and Tian Nansheng, three qian each of ginger-prepared,滑石 (Talc), clam powder, and cinnabar, five qian of xionghuang (Realgar), one qian of badou (Chinese croton seed), three fen each of musk and light powder. Jia Jian Li Jing Wan: Treats phlegm below quickly.

Qian Niu Mo: One liang of Qian Niu powder, five qian of Huaqing, and two and a half qian of Ba Shuang, ground into a paste to form pills the size of beans. Take two to three with broth.

Bao Long Wan: Treats sudden wind, common cold, fright, palpitations, and symptoms of phlegm heat, wind phlegm, and fright phlegm.
Ingredients: One liang of dandan (Citrus aurantium), seven qian of Tianzhu Huang (Curcuma aromatica), five qian each of cinnabar and xionghuang, five and a half qian each of zhi jiang can (Silkworm) and quan xie (Scorpion) without salt, as well as Diaoteng (Rattan), Tianma (Gastrodia elata), half a qian each of Niuhuang (Bovine bile) and musk, three qian of pearl, mixed with licorice syrup to form pills the size of fox nuts. Take one with mint decoction. One variant includes amber.

Xiao Niuhuang Wan: Treats sudden fright with excess phlegm.
Ingredients: One liang each of dandan and cinnabar, five qian of Ba Shuang, mixed with a paste of teeth soap to form pills the size of phoebe seeds. Take three pills each time.

Qingxin Liangge Wan: Treats fright, convulsions, sticking out tongue, phlegm, and wheezing.[331p]

　　南星　半夏　白附各一两　郁金　川乌各三钱　为末，黄牛胆汁拌匀，仍入胆内，扎口高悬，透风阴干，陈久更妙。临用，每两入青黛、焰硝、硼砂、明矾、雄黄、辰砂，各一钱，片脑一分，面糊为丸黍米大，姜汤送下。
　　镇惊丸
　　真琥珀　辰砂飞　青皮　生甘草　珍珠　雄黄各二钱五分　青黛　青礞石　芦荟　柴胡各五钱　天麻　乳香各一两　胆星　天竺黄各二两　甘草膏为丸。慢惊，参朮汤下；急惊，薄荷姜蜜汤下。
　　保生锭　治急惊诸伤食伤风惊骇等证。　　蛇含石四两，醋煅七次　南星一两，汤泡姜汁炒　白附子一两　珍珠　朱砂各五钱　麝香一钱　　右，米糊为锭。

　　礞石丸　治惊风痰盛。
　　胆星　礞石各二两　天竺黄　青黛各五钱　朱砂　芦荟各三钱　蜈蚣烧存性　僵蚕各钱半　甘草膏丸芡实大。
　　通关散　治惊风已退，但声哑无音。　　南星泡　石菖蒲各等分　豮胆汁下，即能言语。[332p]

Nanshing, Banxia, and Baifu, each one tael; Yujin and Chuanwu, each three qian, ground into powder. Mix with fresh yellow cow bile, stuff it back into the bile, tie it up, and hang it high to dry in a cool, shady place. The longer it ages, the better it becomes. For use, every two portions mixed with one qian each of Qingdai, Yanshao, Borsh, Mingfan, Xionghuang, and Chenshi, and one-fifth of the total weight of Piannao, mix with flour to form pills the size of millet. Take with ginger soup.

Zhenjing Pill
True Amber, Chenshi powder, Qingpi, Shenggancao, Pearl, and Xionghuang, each two qian and five fen; Qingdai, Qinglongshi, Aloe, and Chaihu, each five qian; Tianma and Ruxiang, each one tael; Daxing and Tianzhuhuang, each two taels; and mix with licorice paste to form pills. For mild fright, take with Shanzhu soup; for severe fright, take with mint and ginger honey soup.

Baosheng Pill treats acute fright from food injury, wind, and shock.
Shehan stone, four taels, vinegar calcined seven times; Nanshing, one tael, soaked in ginger juice and stir-fried; Bai Fuzhi, one tael; Pearl and Zhusha, each five qian; Musk, one qian. Mix with rice paste to form pills.

Longshi Pill treats fright and excess phlegm.
Daxing and Longshi, each two taels; Tianzhuhuang and Qingdai, each five qian; Zhusha and Aloe, each three qian; centipede charred to a brittle state and silkworms, each one qian and half; mix with licorice paste to form pills the size of Qianshi.

Tongguan Powder treats the aftermath of fright, especially when the voice is hoarse and silent.
Soak Nanshing and Shichangpu in equal parts; add cooled liver bile to restore speech.[332p]

　　搐鼻散
　　半夏　细辛各一钱　荆芥七分　牙皂三钱　麝香二分半　为细末，纸条蘸药取嚏。
　　袪痰镇惊丸　治急惊风，镇惊宁神，退热化痰。幼科去痰食圣药，妙不可言。　　牛胆南星一两　竺黄　僵蚕各五钱　珍珠　全蝎去毒，各一钱　琥珀二钱　朱砂三钱　麝香三分　真金三帖　入药蜜丸芡实大，薄荷姜蜜汤下。一方有牛黄二钱。
　　金枣丹
　　巴豆四十九粒，每日换水，浸二十一日取起，入红枣内，湿纸包煨熟打烂，拌前药为丸，外用金衣，一岁一分，薄荷汤下。
　　天竺丸　治小儿癎证，或惊风不止。　　天竺黄　明天麻　钓藤钩各五钱　枣仁　麦冬各二两　人参　远志　白芍药酒洗　天冬去心，各一两　茯神一两半　桔红七钱　蜜丸如弹子大，水飞朱砂为衣，灯心汤下，每服一丸。
　　青黛丸
　　白附子五钱　南星　天麻　天竺黄各一两半　巴霜一钱半　青黛二两　　右，蜜丸。[333p]

Nasal Powder
To make a fine powder: 1 qian of Banxia (Pinellia), 1 qian of Xixin (Asarum), 7 fen of Jingjie (Schizonepeta), 3 qian of Yazao (Poria), 2.5 fen of Musk. Soak a paper strip in the medicine to induce sneezing.

Phlegm-Expelling Tranquilizing Pills
For treating acute fright and convulsions, calming the mind, reducing fever, and expelling phlegm. A miraculous medicine for children to dispel phlegm. Ingredients: 1 liang of Niuduan (Bile of an Ox), 5 qian each of Zhuhuang (Zhukou), Jiangcan (Silkworm), 1 qian each of Zhenzhu (Pearl) and Quanxie (Scorpion, de-poisoned), 2 qian of Amber, 3 qian of Zhushā (Cinnabar), 3 fen of Musk, and 3 strips of real gold. Form into pill-sized balls mixed with honey and take with a soup of Qianshi (Fox Nut) and ginger honey. An alternate recipe adds 2 qian of Niuhuang (Ox Bile).

Golden Jujube Pill
Take 49 grains of Badou (Croton) and soak them in water, changing the water daily for 21 days. After soaking, put them inside red dates, wrap in moist paper, bake until soft, smash, and mix with previous medicine to form pills. Coat with a gold layer and take with peppermint soup.

Tianzhujun Pills
For treating children's convulsions or persistent fright. Ingredients: 5 qian each of Tianzhuhuang (Corydalis), Mingtianma (Gastrodia), and Diaoteng (Uncaria), 2 liang each of Zaoren (Jujube Seed) and Maidong (Ophiopogon), 1 liang each of Ren Shen (Ginseng), Yuanzhi (Polygala), and Baishaoyao (White Peony, washed in wine), and 1 liang of Tian Dong (Asparagus root, heart removed), 1.5 liang of Fushen (Poria), 7 qian of Juhong (Grapefruit peel). Make into pills the size of small bullets, coated with water-processed zhushā, and take with lampwick soup, one pill per dose.

Qingdai Pills
Ingredients: 5 qian of Bai Fuzhi (Cocculus), 1.5 liang each of Nanshen (Southern Star), Tianma, and Tianzhuhuang, and 1.5 qian of Bashuang (bitter herb), and 2 liang of Qingdai (Indigo). Form into honey pills.[333p]

Yigong San: Treats prolonged vomiting and diarrhea leading to spasms.
Ingredients: Ginseng, Atractylodes Macrocephala, Poria, Honey-fried Licorice, Aged Tangerine Peel, Wood Aroma, Jujube, Fresh Ginger. Boil with water. If lacking Wood Aroma, add Whole Scorpion, Gastrodia, Cicada Slough; for vomiting add Pinellia, Agastache; for diarrhea add Terminalia Chebula, Cimicifuga, Nutmeg; for systemic coldness add Aconite; for inability to speak add Acorus.

Xingpi San: Treats vomiting and diarrhea caused by weakened spleen, effective for spasms.
Ingredients: Ginseng, Atractylodes Macrocephala, Lotus Seed, Honey-fried Licorice, Poria, Whole Scorpion, White Aconite, Gastrodia, Acorus, Wood Aroma, aged rice fried to a golden color. Boil with ginger and jujube.

Jiawei Zhu Fu Tang: Treats chronic spasms with vomiting and diarrhea and cold body, possibly due to internal cold.
Ingredients: Ginseng, fried Atractylodes Macrocephala, Poria, Honey-fried Licorice, Stewed Nutmeg, Prepared Aconite; mỗi three qian boiled with ginger and jujube. Optionally add Wood Aroma.

Jiawei Huiyang San: Treats prolonged spasms with pallid face, reversed cold limbs, and persistent diarrhea.
Ingredients: Ginseng, Atractylodes Macrocephala, Yam, Poria, Licorice, Aconite, Calcined Red Stone Resin, Silkworm, Whole Scorpion; two qian boiled with ginger soup.

Xing Fu San: Treats chronic spasms.
Ingredients: Ginseng, Siler, Whole Scorpion, Silkworm, Qishi Snake, Gallbladder Star, White Aconite, Cicada Slough, White Poria, Amber, Cinnabar each one fen; Musk and Borneol each half li; Niu Huang half fen. Mix with toad bile for oral application, and use clam juice for ingestion.[334p]

Reviving Pill: Treats shock and spirit disturbance.
Ingredients:

  • Ginseng, Atractylodes Macrocephala, Chinese Yam, Poria (each 1 tael)

    Crush into pills, dry in the shade, take with mint Decoction.

Purple River Vehicle Pill: Treats fetal shock.
Ingredients:

  • Ginseng, Gastrodia Elata, Honey-Fried Licorice, Rhinoceros Horn, Licorice Juice Soaked, Talc, Fried White Peony (each 1 tael)
  • Poria Spirit, Jujube Seed (each 1.5 tael)
  • Tansy, Ground Cinnabar (each 5 qian)
  • One Purple River Vehicle, baked and ground
  • Fresh Umbilical Cord burnt on new tiles and separately ground, three strands
    Grind all into a fine powder, mix with 4 taels of Vine Stems Juice and 0.5 jin of honey, form into pills weighing 2 fen, take at bedtime with decoction of lampwick and mint.
    For acute shock, omit Purple River Vehicle, umbilical cord, and ginseng; add 6 qian Honey Fried Silkworms, 6 qian Full Scorpion, 1.2 qian Bovine Yellow, 1 qian Amber, 0.8 qian Gallbladder Star, 0.3 qian Musk.

Spirit-Calming Pill: Treats seizures from fright.
Ingredients:
Equal parts of Ginseng, Amber, Poria Spirit, Licorice Root, Cinnabar, Gastrodia Elata, Acorus Tatarinowii, Asparagus Tuber, Sour Jujube Seed.
Grind into powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of soap nuts, coat with Cinnabar, take each pill with decoction of lampwick and mint.[335p]

　　紫霜丸　治食癎及腹中有食积痰癖，吐哯乳。　　代赭石煅酢淬七次　巴豆三十粒，去皮油　赤石脂各一两　杏仁五十个，去皮尖　　右先将杏仁泥、巴豆霜入二石末相和捣千杵，若硬入少蜜，贮密器中。月内儿服麻子大一粒，乳汁化下，百日内服小豆大。一方赭石二钱，巴豆二十一粒去皮油，杏仁二十一个，　　右末，饭丸粟米大。食癎用此取积，并不虚人。凡儿有热，不欲饮乳，眼睡不宁，常常惊悸，此皆发癎患之渐。即以此药导之，减其盛势，则无惊风钓癎之患矣。
　　五癎丹　治急惊为癎。
　　蜈蚣一条　牛胆南星二钱　全蝎　防风　白附　远志　芦荟　元胡索　辰砂各一钱　麝香一字　金银箔各三片　　右为末，糊丸梧子大，金银箔为衣，每一丸，以薄菏汤化下。[336p]

Purple Frost Pill: Treats epilepsy due to food accumulation and phlegm in the abdomen, resulting in vomiting with milk.

Ingredients:

  • Calcined Redstone, processed with vinegar, seven times
  • Thirty pieces of St. John's bean, peeled and oiled
  • One tael each of Cinnabar and Red Resin
  • Fifty pieces of Apricot Kernel, peeled and pointed

Instructions: First, grind the Apricot Kernel pulp and the powdered St. John's bean together with two stones until it is a fine paste. If it is too hard, add a little honey and store in a sealed container. Within a month, give children a pea-sized amount, which will dissolve in milk; after a hundred days, reduce to a small bean size.

Another formula:

  • Two qian of Redstone
  • Twenty-one pieces of St. John's bean, peeled and oiled
  • Twenty-one pieces of Apricot Kernel

Grind these into a powder and form into pellets the size of millet grains. Use this to treat food accumulation in epilepsy and it will not harm the patient. If a child has heat, refuses milk, has restless sleep, and experiences frequent fright, these are all signs of the onset of epilepsy. Use this medicine to guide it, reduce its intensity, and there will be no risk of seizures.

Five Epilepsy Pill: Treats sudden fright leading to epilepsy.

Ingredients:

  • One Centipede
  • Two qian of Cow Gall and South Star
  • Whole Scorpions
  • Siler
  • White Aconite
  • Polygala
  • Aloe
  • Corydalis
  • Cinnabar, each one qian
  • One character of Musk
  • Three pieces each of Gold and Silver Foil

Instructions: Grind these ingredients into a powder, form into pellets the size of a walnut, and wrap each pellet with gold and silver foil. Each pellet should be dissolved in thin soup for consumption.[336p]

Taiyi San: For treating fetal fright.
Ingredients: Tiangangzi, Tian nanxing, Bai fuz, Tianma, Fangfeng, Bai Fuyin, each 2 qian; Quanxie, Zhushā, each 1 qian; Musk, a pinch.
Grind these into a powder; take 5 fen with milk to induce a downward flow.

Baoyou Huafeng Dan: Treats four symptoms and eight signs of fright and removes wind, phlegm, and heat.
Ingredients: Nanxing, Banxia, Chuanwu, Bai fuz, each 1 liang; Yujin, 5 qian.
Grind these into a powder, pack into the gallbladder of a yellow cow from December. Air dry for a hundred days, then grind into powder. Each liang is mixed with Xionghuang, Zhushā, Bongsā, Yanshao, each 1 qian; a bit of Piaonao and Musk, grind together into a powder, roll into small pills the size of green peas, and dissolve in thin mint soup for taking one or two pills.

Ling Shen Gao:
Ingredients: Chi Fuyin, Zhushā water, each 1 liang; Maidong, 5 qian; Musk, 2.5 qian.
Grind into a powder, mix with honey to make small cakes; take each cake dissolved in mint soup before sleep for remarkable effects. This was passed down from an old physician of three generations specializing in pediatrics, relying on only four or five medicines to cure numerous ailments. For pediatric convulsions, which are often heat-related, the use of fright medications is not advisable; simply use Daohong San with added Fangfeng and bamboo leaves boiled together for two or three doses to expel the heat causing fright and the convulsions will stop; then take Ling Shen Gao.

Jinbo Zhenxin Wan: Treats fright and calms the mind.[337p]

Seven full scorpions wrapped in mint leaves and dried over low heat. Each of red poria, gastrodia, saposhnikovia, notopterygium, cow bile, rhinoceros horn, cinnabar, musk, and licorice one qian. Grind these into a powder, form into honey pills the size of soap nuts, and take one or two pills dissolved in mint tea.

Ningxin Ointment treats children with instability, confusion, fearfulness, excessive crying, and nightmares during sleep. Two qian of cinnabar, one qian each of ginseng, white atractylodes, white poria, polygala, dioscorea, notopterygium, and licorice, a word each of dragon brain and musk. Grind these into a powder, form into honey pills the size of fox nuts, and take with mint tea.

Fangfeng Wenzhentang treats convulsions, dispels phlegm, eases wind, and regulates qi. Two fen of ginseng, five fen each of pinellia, bitter orange, and red poria, two and a half fen each of dried tangerine peel and fangfeng, and one and a half fen of licorice. Grind these to make a paste, add a slice of fresh ginger and two leaves of perilla, decoct in water and take with Dajing Pills and Xiaojing Pills.

Dajing Pills treat convulsions, calm the spirit, and also address heart heat and nocturnal crying. Five qian each of peeled sour jujube seeds and fried licorice, two and a half qian each of ginseng, red poria, white atractylodes, powdered cinnabar, ophiopogon, and sandalwood, as well as calcined and vinegar-treated red earth. One qian and two fen each of fried silkworm and balloon flower, three whole scorpions, and three pieces each of gold and silver foil. Grind these into a powder, form into honey pills the size of walnuts, coat with gold and silver foil, and take one or two pills dissolved in mint tea. Also known as Daan Shen Pills.[338p]

　　白朮散　治吐泻日久不止，津液枯竭，烦渴引饮，欲成慢惊风。　　葛根二钱　人参　白朮　白茯苓　木香　藿香　甘草各一钱　　右粗末，每二钱水煎，任意服。泄泻加山药、白扁豆、肉豆蔻。已成慢惊，加天麻、细辛、全蝎、白附子。惊风泄泻烦渴，皆津液内耗也，不问阴阳，多煎满意取足饮之，弥多弥好。一名清宁散。

Bai Zhu Powder: Treats prolonged vomiting and diarrhea that do not cease, with depletion of fluids, thirst leading to drinking, and potential onset of chronic convulsions.

Ingredients:

  • 2 qian of Guo Gen
  • 1 qian each of Ren Shen, Bai Zhu, Bai Fu Ling, Mu Xiang, Huo Xiang, and Gan Cao.

The above should be ground coarsely. Boil with water (2 qian) and consume as desired. For diarrhea, add Shan Yao, Bai Bian Dou, and Rou Dou Kou. For established chronic convulsions, add Tian Ma, Xi Xin, Quan Xie, and Bai Fu Zi. Convulsions with diarrhea and thirst are due to internal fluid depletion. Without regard to Yin or Yang, boil well and drink until satisfied; the more, the better. Also known as Qing Ning Powder.

Wu Xie Powder: Treats pure Yin chronic convulsions with persistent vomiting and diarrhea.

Ingredients:

  • Four Gentlemen Decoction plus
  • 1 qian each of Chuan Wu, Quan Xie, and Nan Xing.

Grind the ingredients, and add ginger and three jujubes, then boil and consume.

Shen Xiao Powder: Treats chronic convulsions.

Mix one clove of clove, one scorpion, and a pinch of cinnabar. The three ingredients should be ground into powder. For males, use the blood from the middle finger of the left hand; for females, use the blood from the middle finger of the right hand. Dip the blood into the medicine powder and apply it on the child’s lips; this will heal them.[339p]

　　观音散　治脾困多泻，不思乳食，精神昏困，四肢冷，欲成慢惊。　　人参一钱　莲肉　神曲各二分　白朮　黄芪　木香　白扁豆　甘草各一分　白茯苓一分半　　右銼，入姜二枣一，藿香三叶，同煎服。

Guanyin Powder
To treat spleen stagnation with excessive diarrhea, lack of appetite for dairy, mental confusion, cold limbs, and potential development of chronic fright.
Ingredients:

  • Ginseng: 1 qian
  • Lotus seeds: 2 fen
  • Shenqu: 2 fen
  • Atractylodes: 1 fen
  • Astragalus: 1 fen
  • Saussurea: 1 fen
  • White hyacinth bean: 1 fen
  • Licorice: 1 fen
  • White Poria: 1.5 fen
    Prepare by grinding and adding 2 ginger and 2 jujubes, and 3 leaves of mint, then decoct and take.

Whole Scorpion Guanyin Powder
For treating chronic fright after vomiting and diarrhea, also treats chronic spleen wind.
Simply add Qiang Huo, Fang Feng, Tian Ma, and Whole Scorpion to the previous recipe.

Three Flavored Tian Jiang Zi Powder
For treating chronic fright.
Ingredients:

  • Tian Jiang Zi: 3 pieces
  • White silkworm: 3 pieces
  • Whole scorpion: 3 pieces
    Prepare by grinding into a powder, and take with a diluted peppermint decoction.

Spleen Supplement Decoction
For treating chronic fright.

    Grind together to make a single dose, decoct in water and take slightly.

Baosheng Dan
For treating chronic fright.

　　双金丸　治吐泻日久，脾胃虚损，手足厥冷，精神昏塞，多睡露睛，口鼻气冷，欲成慢惊风。　　金液丹　青州白丸子各等分　同研，生姜米饮调灌之，惟多服乃效。虽至危者，往往死中得生，十救八九。沈存中曰：金液丹治慢惊垂危，才服之得活，须多服方验，真小儿吐泻之妙剂也。[341p]

Yansheng Pill: Used for the same conditions as above.

  • South Star powder (2.5 taels), Cinnabar, Cow's bile, Qianghuo (1.2 taels each), Musk (0.6 taels), Scorpion tails (7 pieces), White silkworms (3 pieces). Grind these into a powder, mix with jujube flesh, and form pills the size of mung beans. Take with mint decoction, two pills at a time.

Ginseng and Zhuling Decoction: Treats chronic fright wind, to be taken by both mother and child.

  • Ginseng and White Atractylodes (2 taels each), Pinellia and Gastrodia (0.7 taels each), White Poria and Aged tangerine peel (0.5 taels each), North Asarum, Mint leaves, and Licorice (0.2 taels each), one stir-fried whole scorpion. Grind and prepare as one dose, with three slices of ginger, boil in water and drink.

South Star Drink: Treats chronic fright caused by excessive phlegm, resulting in loss of appetite for milk and food.

  • One large South Star, stir-fried; Winter melon seeds and White Hyacinth bean stir-fried with ginger juice (2 taels each). Grind these into a powder, every 2 taels, take with two slices of ginger and a little Fangfeng, decoct and drink.

Double Gold Pill: Treats prolonged vomiting and diarrhea, resulting in spleen and stomach depletion, cold extremities, dullness of mind, excessive sleepiness, cold breath from mouth and nose, and impending chronic fright wind.

  • Golden liquid pill and Qingzhou White Round Pills in equal parts, ground together, mixed with ginger water for decoction; the more taken, the more effective. Even those in critical condition can often recover, with a success rate of 80-90%. Shen Cunzhong said: The Golden liquid pill treats critical chronic fright; taking it can save lives, and must be taken abundantly to verify its efficacy; it is truly a miraculous remedy for children with vomiting and diarrhea.[341p]

　　备急丸　治急慢惊风。
　　五月五日取白颈蚯蚓不拘多少，去泥焙干为末　　右加朱砂等分，糊九菉豆大，金箔为衣，每一丸白汤下。一法取蚯蚓以竹刀中断之，看取急跳者治急惊，慢跳者治慢惊，各另研烂，和朱砂末作丸菉豆大，入二器贮之，记而用之，神妙。
　　星香散　治急慢惊风搐搦，窜视潮涎。　　南星泡，二钱半　木香　橘红各一钱　全蝎二个　　右銼作一贴，姜四片，水煎频灌，大便去涎，即愈。
　　朱粉散　治急慢惊风。
　　一粒朱砂一片雪轻粉也，七　僵蚕三个蝎，不问惊风与慢风，服时须用生人血乳汁也。　　右先将蚕、蝎微炒燥，取出待冷，同砂粉研为细末，却以母乳汁调抹于儿口内，立效。
　　探生散　治急慢惊风诸药不效，用此吹鼻，定其死生。　　雄黄　没药各一钱　乳香五分　麝香一字　　右为末，吹少许入鼻，如眼泪鼻涕俱出者可治。[342p]

Emergency Pills: For treating sudden and chronic fright.

On the fifth day of the fifth month, take as many white-necked earthworms as you can, clean them of mud, and dry them to a powder. Mix equal parts with vermilion and form into pills the size of a large soybean, coated in gold leaf. Each pill should be taken with clear water. Alternatively, cut the earthworm in half with a bamboo knife, observing which jumps rapidly to treat sudden fright, and the slower ones to treat chronic fright. Grind each separately, mix with vermilion powder, form into pills the size of large soybeans, and store them in two containers for use; this method is remarkably effective.

Star Fragrance Powder: For treating sudden and chronic fright, spasms, and excessive saliva.

Take two and a half qian of southern star, one qian each of wood incense and tangerine peel, and two whole scorpions. Grind these into a powder, add four slices of ginger, and decoct with water to administer frequently. Once there is a bowel movement and salivation ceases, the patient will recover.

Vermilion Powder: For treating sudden and chronic fright.

One grain of vermilion, one slice of snow-white powder, and three dead silkworms. This can be used regardless of sudden or chronic fright, but it must be administered with fresh human milk. First, lightly fry the silkworms and scorpions until slightly dry, then let cool and grind them into a fine powder. Mix this with the milk and apply it to the child’s mouth for immediate effect.

Life-Exploring Powder: When other medicines for sudden and chronic fright are ineffective, use this to blow into the nose to determine life or death.

Take one qian each of realgar and myrrh, half a qian of frankincense, and a small amount of musk. Grind into a powder and blow a small amount into the nose; if tears and nasal discharge occur, it may be treated.[342p]

　　补脾益真汤　治慢脾风。
　　丁香　木香　诃子皮　陈皮　厚朴　草果　肉豆蔻　白葆　人参　白朮　桂枝　半夏　附子炮　甘草炙，各二分　全蝎炒，一枚　　右銼，入姜二枣一，水煎灌服，服讫，令揉心下以助药力。
